56186691271369.author: Jeff Wagner
56186691271369.description: Houdini 18.5 is out and has some nice new features to help TDs and TAs do their day to day work. Join Jeff has he discusses his top ten under-the-radar Features as he takes you on a deep dive into what you can expect from this new release.
56186691271369.name: Presentation - H18.5 HIVE - Top Ten Under-the-Radar Features in H18.5 | H18.5

56186691271370.author: Adam Swaab
56186691271370.description: The new Chain SOP in Houdini 18.5 has a lot of great features for spacing items along a curve. But what do you do with that geometry after layout? Adam is going to do a walk-through of the chain SOP and then show how it was leveraged to create one of his motion graphics pieces.
56186691271370.name: Presentation - H18.5 HIVE - Chain SOP | H18.5

56186691271371.author: Luiz Kruel
56186691271371.description: Luiz explores how the new KineFX character tools in Houdini can be used in support of gamedev projects. He will talk about the motion editing and retargeting tools and how they can be used to refine your motion libraries.
56186691271371.name: Presentation - H18.5 HIVE - KineFX for Games | H18.5

56186691271372.author: Attila Torok
56186691271372.description: Overview of the new/updated H18.5 pyro tools. The new explosion source tools allows you to easily shape your explosions to match real world references. We will use these tools to create sources for explosions ranging from small scale to complex large scale multiple explosions.
56186691271372.name: Presentation - H18.5 HIVE - Sexy Explosions | H18.5

56186691271373.author: Andriy Bilichenko
56186691271373.description: Andriy will talk about my methods of creating the physical properties of various types of fabrics using Houdini Vellum.
56186691271373.name: Presentation - H18.5 HIVE - Vellum Cloth | H18.5

56186691271374.author: Simon Verstraete
56186691271374.description: Houdini 18.5 brings the beta release of the V2 Unreal Engine 4 plugin. New features include PDG support, Session sync connection and World Composition support. Existing features got improved like better UI, overall performance, faster mesh creation and much more.
56186691271374.name: Presentation - H18.5 HIVE - Houdini Engine for UE4 | H18.5

56186691271375.author: Bogdan Zykov
56186691271375.description: Learn how to retarget mocap clips using the new KineFX tools, onto your classic OBJ character rig. Along the way, we will look at how to correct the retargeted character and address issues like interpenetrating geometry, skin weights - and more.
56186691271375.name: Presentation - H18.5 HIVE - Retargeting Animation using KineFX | H18.5

56186691271376.author: Mikael Pettersen
56186691271376.description: Crowds in Houdini 18.5 has become even more powerful thanks to KineFX. In this session, Mikael will demonstrate some of the new ways you can control your agents. IK-Chains on the fly, blending clips, re-targeting, and all the other good stuff.
56186691271376.name: Presentation - H18.5 HIVE - Be in Control - Crowds and KineFX | H18.5

56186691271377.author: Henry Dean
56186691271377.description: A brief tour of the KineFX toolset introduced in Houdini 18.5. We'll be taking a little look under the hood of the toolset, covering a few fundamental concepts and what their implications might be for your future character work.
56186691271377.name: Presentation - H18.5 HIVE - Introducing KineFX | H18.5

56186691271378.author: Mihnea Stoica
56186691271378.description: The tool set designed for animation clean up in the new KineFX toolset. How these tools work and then show a few interesting set ups with them. The tools that we will be covering today are: realistic shoulder, joint stabilization and collision, reverse foot set up and terrain adaptation.
56186691271378.name: Presentation - H18.5 HIVE - Animation Cleanup Tools KineFX | H18.5

56186691271379.author: Paul Lemeshko
56186691271379.description: Learn how to utilize PDG power with Shotgun Publisher Tool to render CG assets with multiple light rigs and publish to Shotgun.
56186691271379.name: Presentation - H18.5 HIVE - PDG Shotgun Publisher Tool | H18.5

56186691271380.author: Rob Stauffer
56186691271380.description: A closer look at some of the great new Solaris features such as the render gallery which lets you save and compare different lighting variations. Learn to quickly switch between different parts of your node graph using insertion points and more.
56186691271380.name: Presentation - H18.5 HIVE - Solaris | H18.5

56187691271369.author: Yunus Balcioglu
56187691271369.description: With complex ocean spectra layered using masks with varying speeds, and even animated timescales, retiming them while keeping the same look is a challenge. Learn how to achieve this as a procedural post retime operation, without having to modify individually.
56187691271369.name: Presentation - WW|HUG: Singapore - Retiming Ocean Spectra & The Pragmatic Approach to Solving Technical Problems in VFX | H18.5

56187691271370.author: Mark Spevick
56187691271370.description: Learn how to take a house model that has been prepped for destruction, start by fracturing the parts then build up constraint networks to hold the pieces together. Learn about all the nodes needed to set up and run both an RBD and PyroFX simulations.
56187691271370.name: Long Tutorial - Destruction FX in SOPs [Multi-part Series] | H18.5

56187691271371.author: Mark Spevick
56187691271371.description: Learn how to create a procedural house that is set up in support of a destruction shot. To make the house procedural, the node network is carefully constructed to ensure that everything will update if the basic shape or the height of the house changes.
56187691271371.name: Long Tutorial - Model a Procedural House [Multi-part Series] | H18.5

56187691271372.author: Paul Ambrosiussen
56187691271372.description: GoZ is Zbrush's fast file transfer feature. This tool allows you to send meshes back and forth between Houdini and Zbrush seamlessly without having to deal with file paths or extensions.
56187691271372.name: Quick Tutorial - SideFX Labs | Go Z Install | H18.5

56187691271373.author: Michael Buckley
56187691271373.description: Learn how to set up Biharmonic Capturing along with a KineFX skeleton. This will involve setting up the tet mesh and all the nodes to capture and deform the geometry. Also learn how to add joints to the skeleton after it is set up and the whole system updates procedurally.
56187691271373.name: Quick Tutorial - Biharmonic Capture | KineFX | H18.5

56187691271374.author: Simon Verstraete
56187691271374.description: Learn how to use the Houdini Niagara Plug-in to bring point cache data saved out as a JSON file into UE4's Niagara system along with attributes such as age, life, id and color. These point caches can be static or animated point clouds created using procedural modeling techniques or using Particle, FLIP Fluid or Rigid Body simulation tools.
56187691271374.name: Long Tutorial - Houdini to Niagara [Multi-part Series] | H18.5

56187691271375.author: VARIOUS
56187691271375.description: Learn what the experts think should go into your VFX reel, and tips on applying to studios.
56187691271375.name: Presentation - HIVE Education - PANEL: How to Make a Killer Reel and Get a Job at a Studio | H18.5

56187691271376.author: Sophie Noel, Mathieu Rondet
56187691271376.description: Breakdown of FX behind the ArtFX 2020 graduation short, Haru & Houdini teaching approach at ArtFX.
56187691271376.name: Presentation - HIVE Education - Procedural Approaches for Magical FX | H18.5

56187691271377.author: Ronny Franken, Zoran Arizanovic, Robbie Griggvv, Bojan Endrovski
56187691271377.description: An overview of our Games programme and how we use and include procedural content in our curriculum and project structure. Our games education has a strong focus on AAA game development across all disciplines and development pipelines.
56187691271377.name: Presentation - HIVE Education - Procedural at BUas | H18.5

56187691271378.author: David Tree
56187691271378.description: A variety of research projects which have been achieved using Houdini. Furthermore we will explore how Houdini has become the go-to tool to teach problem solving within our degree programme encouraging our students to become creative problem solvers.
56187691271378.name: Presentation - HIVE Education - The Swiss Army Knife and the Research Lab | H18.5

56187691271379.author: Daniel Hourigan
56187691271379.description: Teaching Houdini for use in the VFX industry with simplified examples. I will discuss why only following tutorials isn't always the best way to cement knowledge and understanding, and talk about how having an idea or goal is often the best way to learn and create unique solutions.
56187691271379.name: Presentation - HIVE Education - Houdini Unpacked | H18.5

56187691271380.author: Sean Lewkiw
56187691271380.description: Modern studios feature a set naming convention, pipeline, and directory structure. This makes organizing files much easier. Sean shows you how to build your own shot environment with auto-directory creation with zero knowledge of Python, and all in only 13 lines of code!
56187691271380.name: Presentation - HIVE Education - A Pipeline in Thirteen Lines of Python | H18.5

56187691271381.author: Yoshihiro Miura
56187691271381.description: Yoshihiro covers the procedural modeling of Japanese castle in Houdini in three parts: the stone foundation, the turrets and the gables, and then the town around the castle.
56187691271381.name: Presentation - HIVE Education - Procedural Modeling of Japanese Castle | H18.5

56187691271382.author: Matt Brunner
56187691271382.description: How do you introduce a production software package as massive and interesting as Houdini to new students? This talk is about the dilemmas I've faced answering that question and some of the solutions and results that I have come up with.
56187691271382.name: Presentation - HIVE Education - How to Learn Houdini from Scratch in 13 Weeks | H18.5

56187691271383.author: Areito Echevarria, Raqi Syed, Sunny Teich
56187691271383.description: Areito Echevarria presents a call to action for industry people thinking about getting into the education sector, Raqi Syed shows us how the ideas of the old masters are still relevant when teaching lighting in Houdini, Sunny Teich shows how her students translate verbs into VFX.
56187691271383.name: Presentation - HIVE Education - WELLYWOOD VFX | H18.5

56187691271384.author: Jan Mentzel, Ruben Tack
56187691271384.description: For many years we struggled to find the best way to teach math to aspiring 3D artists. Trying something radically different, we instead chose to work with Houdini, using VOPs and simple geometry to explain fundamental mathematical concepts.
56187691271384.name: Presentation - HIVE Education - Adding the Fun to Math Fundamentals | H18.5

56187691271385.author: Thomas Renault, Thomas Spony, Maxime Salvatore
56187691271385.description: Stranded is a graduation short film, made by 7 students from ESMA school in Montpellier, France. Members of the team and instructor talk about their experiences learning at ESMA and working in this production done almost entirely in Houdini.
56187691271385.name: Presentation - HIVE Education - Production of Stranded | H18.5

56187691271386.author: Antoine Dupriez & Migrant Movie Team
56187691271386.description: During this breakdown, I will show you how Houdini helped us to create our environment, to produce our special effects and to work on the look development of our characters.
56187691271386.name: Presentation - HIVE Education - Breakdown of the Graduation Short 'Migrants' | H18.5

56187691271387.author: Luke Vuilliomenet
56187691271387.description: An exploration into Houdini 18 Flip fluids, in order to replicate a real-life reference as closely as possible.
56187691271387.name: Presentation - HIVE Education - Flooding Stairs: Flip Fluids & Real-Life References | H18.5

56187691271388.author: Aleksandra Radivilovic, Erwin Smeenge, Jens van Kampen, Joshua Rizzo, Peter Prickarz
56187691271388.description: A group of 3rd-yr students from BUas will go over their tools / projects they made using Houdini. These tools are created to supply several game projects and cover topics such as procedural characters, building destruction, procedural landscapes and racetrack generation.
56187691271388.name: Presentation - HIVE Education - BUas Procedural Showcase | H18.5

56187691271389.author: Felipe Amaya
56187691271389.description: An insider's look at the process of an academic production simulation: from pre to post- production.
56187691271389.name: Presentation - HIVE Education - Abducting the Car, An Automobile Commercial | H18.5

56187691271390.author: Rodney Mutanga
56187691271390.description: Three different sections of the Procedural tool and this will include going through the sub-networks that are involved in creating the surface geometry and the internal structure. I will also cover how these two sections are combined together to generate the Houdini digital asset.
56187691271390.name: Presentation - HIVE Education - Procedural Crystal Generation | H18.5

56187691271391.author: Nathan Clark
56187691271391.description: Focus is on the magic crystals project that was set for students by DNEG. I will first talk about my approach for this sort of project. I will then go into the lightning-based effect in more detail and explain my process for creating procedural lightning geometry with VEX and VOPs.
56187691271391.name: Presentation - HIVE Education - Creating Lightning with VEX | H18.5

56187691271392.author: Simon Verstraete
56187691271392.description: Houdini Engine for UE4 V2 plugin lets you connect to a session of Houdini Engine running inside Houdini. Changes you make on either end, whether in UE4 or in Houdini, will be synchronized to allow both applications to make changes and see the same results.
56187691271392.name: Quick Tutorial - Houdini Engine for UE4 | H18.5

56187691271393.author: Paul Ambrosiussen
56187691271393.description: How Houdini Engine can help game developers create procedural content in art-directable ways to use in Unity. Using the new SessionSync functionality, we'll show how developers can work with procedural tools bi-directionally between Unity and Houdini.
56187691271393.name: Long Tutorial - Directed Procedural Workflows with Houdini and Unity | H18.5

56187691271394.author: Simon Verstraete
56187691271394.description: Building large scale environment for games can consist of several key elements including the base terrain, scattered landscape features, foliage and man-made props. In this lesson, learn how to set up all of these elements using procedural techniques in Houdini.
56187691271394.name: Long Tutorial - Procedural Desert [Multi-part Series] | H18.5

56187691271395.author: Moeen Sayed
56187691271395.description: A beginner tutorial series for learning to code in Houdini using VEX and is a companion series to the 'Houdini Isn't Scary' tutorial series. No prior understanding of coding or VEX concepts is necessary. Everything from variables to if-statements to functions are explained in this series.
56187691271395.name: Long Tutorial - Vex Isn't Scary [Multi-part Series] | H18.5

56187691271396.author: Guillaume Laferriere
56187691271396.description: Explore the KineFX Curve Solver VOP example file from the Rig Attribute VOP help page. The scene shows how to capture a tube from a dynamic number of KineFX joints and how to use the various signatures of the Curve Solver VOP node.
56187691271396.name: Quick Tutorial - KineFX: Curve Solver VOP | H18.5

56187691271397.author: Guillaume Laferriere
56187691271397.description: The scene shows how to use Transform from Path VOP and Scene Character Export SOP to constrain a camera on a path.
56187691271397.name: Quick Tutorial - KineFX: Camera on Path SOP Constraint | H18.5

56187691271398.author: Guillaume Laferriere
56187691271398.description: Explore the KineFX IK Solver VOP example file from the Rig Attribute VOP help page. The scene shows how to capture a tube from a dynamic number of KineFX joints and how to use the various signatures of the IK Solver VOP node.
56187691271398.name: Quick Tutorial - KineFX: IK Solver SOP | H18.5

56187691271399.author: Fianna Wong
56187691271399.description: The general setup that you can use, to map animation data onto an existing rig (OBJ-level rig or .fbx). We will look at using Rig Match Pose, Map Points, Full Body IK and other settings, which are a part of the new KineFX toolset. Download the Sofia character and try it!
56187691271399.name: Quick Tutorial - KineFX: Motion Retargeting | H18.5

56187691271400.author: Fianna Wong
56187691271400.description: The Render Gallery allows you to make 'snapshots' of the current view. This captures any settings that were used to create that view and so when you have many snapshots, you can diff between them to make better evaluations of your scene (whether it is lighting or shaders, etc.).
56187691271400.name: Quick Tutorial - Solaris Render Gallery | H18.5

56187691271401.author: Fianna Wong
56187691271401.description: This video will cover how to use the Physical Lens shader and set your focus plane for rendering, so that you can set specific areas of your scene to get the depth of field in your render.
56187691271401.name: Quick Tutorial - Physical Lens and Focus Plane | H18.5

56187691271402.author: Fianna Wong
56187691271402.description: You can now interactively assign bevels by selecting (or deselecting) edges or points. Pre-highlighted selections appear when you hover over your geo, and allow you to evaluate and make decisions about your geometry much faster.
56187691271402.name: Quick Tutorial - PolyBevel | H18.5

56187691271403.author: Todd Dufour
56187691271403.description: This 3 part series will take an in depth look at the often overlooked features and uses for the metaball tools in Houdini.
56187691271403.name: Presentation - WW|HUG: Chicago - Mighty Metaballs [Multi-part Series] | H18

56187691271404.author: Michael Buckley
56187691271404.description: Learn how to setup a Top Geometry SOP to process its input through a compiled SOP network, while wedging the parameters of the network with TOP attributes. This technique can be used in replacement of a SOP For-Loop.
56187691271404.name: Quick Tutorial - PDG | Wedging a Compile SOP Network | H18

56187691271405.author: Mike Lyndon
56187691271405.description: A walkthrough of the Houdini to Niagara workflow.
56187691271405.name: Quick Tutorial - Houdini To Niagara Workflow | H18

56187691271406.author: Han Han Xue
56187691271406.description: The design foundation principles of transformation, abstraction, and repetition to help inspire you to overcome what he calls the staleness that is being felt in the current digital content creation environment.
56187691271406.name: Presentation - WW|HUG: San Francisco - Transformation, Abstraction, Repetition, and How to Think Like a Chef | H18

56187691271407.author: Delano Athias
56187691271407.description: A glimpse into Houdini's animation tools. We'll learn how to setup our f-curve interpolation for Pose-to-Pose animation blocking, how to polish animation, and we'll also learn how quick and convenient it is to simulate a handheld camera with Motion FX.
56187691271407.name: Presentation - WW|HUG: Los Angeles - Character Animation in Houdini | H18

56187691271408.author: Guilherme Casagrandi & Fabricio Chamon
56187691271408.description: Learn about some uses of CHOPs in the areas of music, MIDI and constraints and how It can improve workflows.
56187691271408.name: Presentation - WW|HUG: Sao Paolo - CHOPs for Music and Constraints | H18

56187691271409.author: Arnold Song
56187691271409.description: Covers the entire workflow of a Houdini cinematic project, titled 'Escape', under a tight production schedule. It will include planning, modeling, FX, and final rendering in Solaris.
56187691271409.name: Presentation - WW|HUG: Los Angeles - Escape' Project Workflow | H18

56187691271410.author: Simon Verstraete
56187691271410.description: Explore the finished Level Builder asset and see how you can use it to create complete levels using a single curve. You can then peek into the tool to better understand how it works and how all of the pieces come together to create a rich game environment.
56187691271410.name: Long Tutorial - Post Apocalyptic Ruins [Multi-part Series] | H18

56187691271411.author: Michael Buckley
56187691271411.description: This lesson shows how to use the new Ruler tool found in SideFX Labs (https://www.sidefx.com/products/sidefx-labs/). It is in beta so you need to turn off the production build option when installing or updating Labs.
56187691271411.name: Quick Tutorial - SideFX Labs | Ruler | H18

56187691271412.author: Anatolii Iudanov & Alexey Vanzhula
56187691271412.description: Come hang with us as we talk with XAPKOHHEH (otherwise known as Anatolii Iudanov) and Alexey Vanzhula. There will be excessive laughter, talking about 3D, stories from the past, and also there will be a presentation from XAPKOHHEH, revolving pyro and vellum.
56187691271412.name: Presentation - WW|HUG: Toronto - Coffee Time with ????????? + Alexey Vanzhula | H18

56187691271413.author: Ivan DeWolf
56187691271413.description: After buying a toy drawing machine, I could not find a good system to build gcode for it from an SVG file, so I made a system that generates gcode for a drawing machine directly from a python SOP, and have generated several ballpoint pen plots from Houdini using the system.
56187691271413.name: Presentation - WW|HUG: Vancouver - Generating G-Code | H18

56187691271414.author: Franco Pizzani
56187691271414.description: Franco will take a look at a simple traffic simulation system built in a POPNET using VEX. We will start by quickly going over a reynolds boids setup showcasing some of the principles of crowds simulation, and we will learn about some useful VEX functions.
56187691271414.name: Presentation - WW|HUG: Vancouver - VEX Traffic Simulation | H18

56187691271415.author: Simon Verstraete
56187691271415.description: The 3D viewport now has display options for adding uniform fog effects. You can visualize this fog using OpenGL with controls for density, opacity, height and depth range. You can also add a distant light to act as the sun and control how the sunlight interacts with the fog.
56187691271415.name: Quick Tutorial - Viewport Fog | H18

56187691271416.author: Simon Verstraete
56187691271416.description: The Unity plugin now lets you connect to a session of Houdini Engine running inside Houdini. The state of Houdini Engine can be viewed in Houdini while working with the plugin in Unity. Changes will be synchronized to allow both applications to make changes and see the same results.
56187691271416.name: Quick Tutorial - Houdini Engine for Unity | Session Sync | H18

56187691271417.author: Fianna Wong
56187691271417.description: This Quickstart video will cover how to use Topo Transfer to project clean quad head geometry onto a dense and non-uniform scanned mesh geometry, to get a resulting clean geometry while capturing the features from the scan.
56187691271417.name: Quick Tutorial - Topo Transfer | H18

56187691271418.author: Fianna Wong
56187691271418.description: Path Deform bends geometry to follow the shape of a curve, then lets you apply secondary deformations such as scaling and twisting. This tool can be used to deform a long flexible object into a desired shape.
56187691271418.name: Quick Tutorial - Path Deform | H18

56187691271419.author: Gabriela Salmeron
56187691271419.description: Barry Bacon is our character, which we will groom and render in Houdini. This is a short course, made up of two parts. Part 1 covers how to prepare your scene, comb guides and add parting lines. Part 2 goes over how to generate hair, clump them, add variations and render it in Mantra.
56187691271419.name: Long Tutorial - Grooming Barry Bacon [Multi-part Series] | H18

56187691271420.author: Manuel Koster
56187691271420.description: Neural Style Transfer is a method of transferring a style of one image to another image using Machine Learning. This project focusses on leveraging PDG to distribute work needed for the stylisation.
56187691271420.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Neural Video Style Transfer Leveraging PDG | H18

56187691271421.author: Kyle Sowry
56187691271421.description: Learn how Kyle used Houdini's PDG to accomplish a hard-flooring retailer's mission to show their product range across a variety of household interiors.
56187691271421.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Product Proceduralization | H18

56187691271422.author: Ted Pallas
56187691271422.description: Join us for an orientation to virtual production, content production pipelines, strategies for managing work on a tight calendar, strategies for collaborating as a team, and the differences between the real-time engines I work with: Notch, Unreal and Touchdesigner.
56187691271422.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Virtual Production Strategies | H18

56187691271423.author: Sam Swift-Glasman
56187691271423.description: Five's Sam Swift-Glasman talks through some novel Houdini use cases. This powerful platform can be a fantastic tool for prototyping models, testing algorithms and data visualisation to support Autonomous Vehicle development.
56187691271423.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Houdini for the Mad Scientist | H18

56187691271424.author: Robert Magee
56187691271424.description: Learn the similarities and differences between Houdini and Maya, then dive deeper to understand how each app works under the hood. You will also learn about the Houdini Engine for Maya plug-in which allows you to share Houdini Digital Assets with colleagues working in Maya.
56187691271424.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Maya to Houdini Transition Guide | H18

56187691271425.author: Matt Estela
56187691271425.description: Matt presents another round of quick tips to make your Houdini life easier. This is a mixed bag of stuff for beginner, intermediate, advanced, so hopefully something for everyone.
56187691271425.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Just the Tip(s) | H18

56187691271426.author: Updates and Some Sneaky Peeky
56187691271426.description: Fianna's excited to show you a bit of what's been cooking in the SideFX kitchen. Of course, you won't see the full menu but, just a taste :)
56187691271426.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Updates and Some Sneaky Peeky | H18

56187691271427.author: Tim van Heldsingen
56187691271427.description: Tim covers the fundamental building blocks of what makes houdini great and how understanding the fundamentals helps make you a better artist and learn a lot quicker.
56187691271427.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Master the Fundamentals | H18

56187691271428.author: Tim Bolland
56187691271428.description: My plan is to run you through a typical ManvsMachine project, beginning with our directors treatment and then realizing it through Houdini's extensive toolset.
56187691271428.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - MANvsMACHINE | H18

56187691271429.author: Rok Andic
56187691271429.description: In this presentation Rok will show how he used Houdini to create the main character for the animated short film 'B is for Ben'.
56187691271429.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - B is for Ben: Creating the Character in Houdini | H18

56187691271430.author: Nikolay Skolkov
56187691271430.description: When you are pressed for time and you have to simulate water for a crowd of drowning survivors, you have to find a way to provide each survivor with their own unique splash. In my case, the only solution for that was particles! I'm going to tell you how POPs saved the time for me.
56187691271430.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Water Splashes on the Cheap (FLIP-Free) | H18

56187691271431.author: Mikael Pettersen
56187691271431.description: Dive deeper into Houdini's crowd workflow. Mikael will demonstrate how to set up blend shapes and how to use the full-body IK solver in VEX to give you even more control over your agents.
56187691271431.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Do More With Crowds | H18

56187691271432.author: Marc Joos and Adam Figielski
56187691271432.description: Learn how highly orchestrated FX techniques brought  aircrafts, ships and the Pacific ocean to life. Through detailed historical research, previs, animation and various software, Pixomondo's visual effects in the film vividly recreated the past so audiences could experience it in the present.
56187691271432.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Ready for Battle: The FX in Midway | H18

56187691271433.author: Keith Kamholz
56187691271433.description: Destruction-specialist Keith Kamholz discusses his preferred workflow for RBD-based vehicle destruction - incl asset preparation, building flexible dynamic RBD rigs, the simulation itself, and how to apply that simulation to the final render geometry.
56187691271433.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Vehicle Destruction & Dynamic Rigging with RBDs | H18

56187691271434.author: Hudson Martins
56187691271434.description: Hudson's talk is aimed towards artists and supervisors alike - sharing knowledge and experience adapted from being a Houdini generalist artist and to managing a team of FX artists across multiple disciplines.
56187691271434.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Artist to Leader | H18

56187691271435.author: David Adan
56187691271435.description: Showcases workflows for destruction of natural assets such as trees, plants and other organic objects. Also shows some procedural modeling techniques, streamlining asset creation with TOPs, and handling of large amounts of data.
56187691271435.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Natural Destruction | H18

56187691271436.author: Ahmed Gharraph
56187691271436.description: Ahmed details how his team created stunning CG Hummingbirds and a rainforest for drinks brand Purdey's and solved a case full of worms for Netflix on global-smash The Witcher - and how Framestore's television department killed off Doctor Manhattan for Watchmen.
56187691271436.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Battle Worms, Birds, and Big Blue Beings | H18

56187691271437.author: Tyler Bay
56187691271437.description: Houdini 18's new sparse pyro solver features a workflow which offers a great way of handling combustion. In this tutorial, Tyler Bay provides an overview of how this new workflow generally operates while providing useful tips along the way.
56187691271437.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - The Sparse Pyro Process | H18

56187691271438.author: Varomix
56187691271438.description: Learn how to get started using Autodesk Arnold renderer in Solaris. From initial setup to final render, we will work through a practical shot to learn how you can render USD with Arnold in the LOPS context.
56187691271438.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Look Who's Back: Arnold for Solaris | H18

56187691271439.author: Sarah Forcier
56187691271439.description: Sarah showcases RenderMan's tight integration with Houdini, showing features used at Pixar as well as new advancements in rendering technology. It's a great opportunity to see the latest technology coming from Pixar.
56187691271439.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Renderman for Houdini | H18

56187691271440.author: Paul Ambrosiussen
56187691271440.description: Paul provides a quick overview of the new tools that have recently been added to the SideFX Labs toolset. Find out what the new tools are, and how we have made it a lot easier to install SideFX Labs.
56187691271440.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - SideFX Labs: Tools for Everyone | H18

56187691271441.author: Maxime Hacquard
56187691271441.description: Shows how Houdini can be used to solve creative problems in the advertising and motion graphics world. Far from the VFX and technical use of Houdini, here are some workflows used to produce better and faster as an artist.
56187691271441.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Houdini as a Vector of Creativity | H18

56187691271442.author: Mark Fancher
56187691271442.description: Mark breaks down his approach to Houdini and how he uses it to create abstract simulations, morphs, and formations. He shows how these effects are used to add emphasis to some of the product visualization work he's done.
56187691271442.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Motion Design Hacks | H18

56187691271443.author: Lukas Vojir & Alexa Sirbu
56187691271443.description: Using Houdini's Proceduralism and Simulation tools with strong art and design intentions.
56187691271443.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Design x Stimulation | H18

56187691271444.author: Henry Foster
56187691271444.description: Henry gives a quick overview of the MOPs toolkit, shows how it can make motion graphics much easier in Houdini, and then shows how it can be applied outside of the motion graphics world.
56187691271444.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - MOPS: Beyond Motion Graphics | H18

56187691271445.author: David Ferreira
56187691271445.description: David does a detailed walkthrough the process he used to explore the idea of paintings in motion. He covers everything from the artistic drive and inspiration to the technical solutions he came up with to bring the idea to life.
56187691271445.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Paintings in Motion | H18

56187691271446.author: Adrien Lambert
56187691271446.description: Explore the different steps of environment creation within Houdini and Redshift. From terrain modelling, to final render.
56187691271446.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Creating Cinematic Environments | H18

56187691271447.author: Will MacNeil
56187691271447.description: I look at projects including my painting tool, called Stroke-it, and how I built mountainscapes for a recent branding project for Al Jazeera English. I'll also talk about how Houdini fits into our design studio and some thoughts on leveraging procedural work to speed things up.
56187691271447.name: Presentation - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Paint, Peaks and Primitives | H18

56187691271448.author: Rob Stauffer
56187691271448.description: Next, we will take the scene layout and light it using the lighting tools of Solaris. Learn how to control things like brightness and shadows using viewport tools. Dial in your lights with light linking and the light mixer. Set up a multi shot render and kick it off using PDG.
56187691271448.name: Long Tutorial - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Solaris Workshop - Lighting/Multi-Shot Rendering | H18

56187691271449.author: Steven Knipping
56187691271449.description: Ingesting a USD scene with Solaris, isolating and fracturing desired areas, simulation, and reintegration back into the overall USD scene for downstream use.
56187691271449.name: Long Tutorial - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Solaris Workshop - Rigid Body Fracturing with Solaris | H18

56187691271450.author: Simon Littlejohn
56187691271450.description: With the simplicity of USD, this tutorial showcases how an FX artist can improve their workflow and create production ready magical elements. Simple VEX, sparse pyro, and creative solutions to vary the look of simulations will help push your FX to the next level.
56187691271450.name: Long Tutorial - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Solaris Workshop - Magic Cauldron | H18

56187691271451.author: Mohamed Kamal Abujazar
56187691271451.description: Learn a new efficient method for solving and simulating trees, especially those with thick trunks and branches. This effect is accomplished by using the soft body simulation (wire solver) and dynamic constraint. Also learn how to use the Pyro FX solver for animating trees.
56187691271451.name: Long Tutorial - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Solaris Workshop - Photorealistic Tree Sims Driven by Velocity Fields | H18

56187691271452.author: Rob Stauffer
56187691271452.description: Learn how to take existing assets that were authored in USD and start build out a layout and scene graph using Solaris.  Explore typical LOP-based tools such as the stage manager and then learn how to buildup scenes using the layers coming from other departments.
56187691271452.name: Long Tutorial - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Solaris Workshop - Layout and Scene Assembly | H18

56187691271453.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271453.description: Prep geometry inside Houdini's SOP context so that it can be exported to USD with support for features such as variants. Comparing Houdini and USD primitives are addressed along with importing all Houdini Primitive types. Materials in construction and export to Solaris.
56187691271453.name: Long Tutorial - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Solaris Workshop - Asset Prep for Solaris | H18

56187691271454.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271454.description: How Solaris fits into Pipelines. Rendering with ROPs and TOPs are compared. In addition, the command line render tool Husk is explored. Specific attention will be spent on large scene management and the use of Value Clips to keep scenes within the limits of available memory.
56187691271454.name: Long Tutorial - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Solaris Workshop - Solaris and Pipelines | H18

56187691271455.author: Rob Stauffer
56187691271455.description: Covers the basics of USD, from composition arcs to variants. Using examples inside of Houdini, we build very simple scene graphs illustrating these concepts.
56187691271455.name: Long Tutorial - Houdini HIVE Worldwide - Solaris Workshop - Intro to USD Concepts | H18

56187691271456.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271456.description: Learn how to ingest an Alembic file into Houdini then set it up to be used in the Solaris/LOPS context. You will learn how the USD Scene Graph is built and how you can use it to work with the either assemblies or individual primitives.
56187691271456.name: Long Tutorial - Prep Assets for Solaris / LOPs [Multi-part Series] | H18

56187691271457.author: Simon Verstraete
56187691271457.description: Learn how to create dungeon props using a number of different modeling techniques in Houdini. In each of the following lessons, you learn how to create a kit of parts that can be combined to create unique props.
56187691271457.name: Long Tutorial - Dungeon Props [Multi-part Series] | H18

56187691271458.author: Michael Buckley
56187691271458.description: Explore a TOPs workflow for taking a number of geometry files and corresponding texture maps, bringing each one into Houdini, hooking up the textures to a shader, and rendering the geometry.
56187691271458.name: Long Tutorial - Process and Render Geometry and Textures with TOPS | H18

56187691271459.author: Simon Verstraete
56187691271459.description: The WaveFunctionCollapse algorithm is used to define the base shapes of a game level - then a Houdini Digital Asset is built to generate a variety of different dungeons in UE4.
56187691271459.name: Long Tutorial - WFC Dungeon [Multi-part Series] | H18

56187691271460.author: Mike Houle
56187691271460.description: While Houdini's visualization interface lets you attach visualizations to specific nodes, sometimes you want to move the same visualization around to different nodes in a geometry network to inspect the geometry as it moves through the network.
56187691271460.name: Quick Tutorial - Visualize SOP | Node Reference | H17.5

56187691271461.author: Mike Houle
56187691271461.description: Use the Tube SOP to create open or closed tubes, cones, or pyramids. Create cones by entering a value of zero for either the top or bottom radius in the Parameters.
56187691271461.name: Quick Tutorial - Tube SOP | Node Reference | H17.5

56187691271462.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271462.description: The Transform SOP transforms the source geometry in 'object space' using a transformation matrix. All primitives selected will receive the same transform. To vary the transform by a point attribute, use the Transform By Attribute SOP.
56187691271462.name: Quick Tutorial - Transform SOP | Node Reference | H17.5

56187691271463.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271463.description: The Transform SOP transforms the source geometry in 'object space' using a transformation matrix. All primitives selected will receive the same transform. To vary the transform by a point attribute, use the Transform By Attribute SOP.
56187691271463.name: Quick Tutorial - Transform SOP | Local Variables | Node Reference | H17.5

56187691271464.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271464.description: The Transform SOP transforms the source geometry in 'object space' using a transformation matrix. All primitives selected will receive the same transform. To vary the transform by a point attribute, use the Transform By Attribute SOP.
56187691271464.name: Quick Tutorial - Transform SOP | Invert Transform | Node Reference | H17.5

56187691271465.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271465.description: The Transform SOP transforms the source geometry in 'object space' using a transformation matrix. All primitives selected will receive the same transform. To vary the transform by a point attribute, use the Transform By Attribute SOP.
56187691271465.name: Quick Tutorial - Transform SOP | Attributes | Node Reference | H17.5

56187691271466.author: Mike Houle
56187691271466.description: The Sphere SOP generates spherical objects of different geometry types. It is capable of creating non-uniform scalable spheres of all geometry types. If an input is provided, the sphere's radius is automatically determined as a function of the input's bounding geometry.
56187691271466.name: Quick Tutorial - Sphere SOP | Node Reference | H17.5

56187691271467.author: Rob Stauffer
56187691271467.description: The Scatter SOP distributes new points across the surface in a roughly uniform pattern and optionally attempts to limit clumping and holes. For volume primitives, this node scatters points through the volume with a density proportional to the field value.
56187691271467.name: Quick Tutorial - Scatter SOP | Node Reference | H17.5

56187691271468.author: Mike Houle
56187691271468.description: The NULL SOP acts simply as a placeholder to make wiring networks easier, or to allow you to reference a single output SOP without having to update all the references to it if the real output SOP changes. This SOP passes through its input untouched, so it does no cooking.
56187691271468.name: Quick Tutorial - Null SOP | Node Reference | H17.5

56187691271469.author: Rob Stauffer
56187691271469.description: The Mountain SOP displaces points along their normals based on fractal noise. This node uses normal attributes on the input geometry. If a normal has 0 length, this operator will not displace the point along that normal.
56187691271469.name: Quick Tutorial - Mountain SOP | Node Reference | H17.5

56187691271470.author: Mike Houle
56187691271470.description: The Line SOP creates polygon or NURBS lines from a position, direction, and distance.
56187691271470.name: Quick Tutorial - Line SOP | Node Reference | H17.5

56187691271471.author: Mike Houle
56187691271471.description: When using the Copy to Point SOP, you can use attributes to control the various instances.
56187691271471.name: Quick Tutorial - Copy to Points | Instance Attributes | Part 1 | H17.5

56187691271472.author: Camden Wright
56187691271472.description: The Group SOP generates groups of points, primitives, edges, or vertices according to various criteria. Elements can occur in more than one group. Groups are used in many parts of the Parameter Editor to specify which portions of input geometry you wish an operator to act upon.
56187691271472.name: Quick Tutorial - Group SOP | Part 1 | Node Reference | H17.5

56187691271473.author: Mike Houle
56187691271473.description: The Delete SOP deletes input geometry by group, entity number, bounding volume, primitive/point/edge normals, and/or degeneracy.
56187691271473.name: Quick Tutorial - Delete SOP | Part 1 | Node Reference | H17.5

56187691271474.author: Camden Wright
56187691271474.description: The Copy and Transform SOP creates copies of geometry and applies successive transformations to them. The transformations are cumulative and the original selection isn't transformed. The original copy is included in the copy number.
56187691271474.name: Quick Tutorial - Copy and Transform SOP | Node Reference | H17.5

56187691271475.author: Mike Houle
56187691271475.description: The Copy to Points SOP copies geometry in the first input onto the points of the second input. This is very useful for populating scenes with repeated elements such as trees, buildings, or snowflakes with full control over the placement of the copies.
56187691271475.name: Quick Tutorial - Copy to Points SOP | Node Reference | H17.5

56187691271476.author: Mike Houle
56187691271476.description: The Color SOP adds color attributes to geometry. The color (Cd) attribute affects the display of the wireframe, and of faces in non-VEX shaded mode. The default shader in mantra, and many other shaders, will also use the attribute for rendering.
56187691271476.name: Quick Tutorial - Color SOP | Node Reference | H17.5

56187691271477.author: Mike Houle
56187691271477.description: The Circle SOP creates open or closed arcs, circles and ellipses. It is used to create circles and ellipses. If you click and drag the mouse, it generates a circle whose radii are specified by your drag.
56187691271477.name: Quick Tutorial - Circle SOP | Node Reference | H17.5

56187691271478.author: Mike Houle
56187691271478.description: The Box SOP creates a cube or six-sided rectangular box.
56187691271478.name: Quick Tutorial - Box SOP | Node Reference | H17.5

56187691271479.author: Mike Houle
56187691271479.description: The Blast SOP seletes primitives, points, edges or breakpoints. Blast is designed to remove geometry that you select interactively in the viewport, as opposed to Delete which is a more procedural tool.
56187691271479.name: Quick Tutorial - Blast SOP | Node Reference | H17.5

56187691271480.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271480.description: The Attribute Create SOP adds or edits user defined attributes. The attribute can be a float, integer, vector, or string type. If the local variable name is not specified, the attribute name (all in upper case) will be used.
56187691271480.name: Quick Tutorial - Attribute Create SOP | Local Variables | Node Reference | H17.5

56187691271481.author: Rob Stauffer
56187691271481.description: The Attribute Randomize SOP generates random attribute values of various distributions. This node generates random values to create or modify an attribute.
56187691271481.name: Quick Tutorial - Attribute Randomize SOP | Node Reference | H17.5

56187691271482.author: Mike Houle
56187691271482.description: The Attribute Create SOP adds or edits user defined attributes. The attribute can be a float, integer, vector, or string type. If the local variable name is not specified, the attribute name (all in upper case) will be used.
56187691271482.name: Quick Tutorial - Attribute Create SOP | Node Reference | H17.5

56187691271483.author: Simon Verstraete
56187691271483.description: Create a city block using data acquired from Open Street Map [OSM]. This information will be processed using three tools from SideFX Labs combined into a Houdini Digital Asset that can be loaded into UE4 using the Houdini Engine plug-in.
56187691271483.name: Long Tutorial - City Building with OSM Data [Multi-part Series] | H18

56187691271484.author: Simon Verstraete
56187691271484.description: Techniques that can be used by game artists to create procedural assets that have modeling, uv unwrapping, and baking built in. These assets can then be loaded into game editors such as Unity and Unreal using the Houdini Engine plug-in technology to maintain their procedural nature.
56187691271484.name: Presentation - HIVE GameDev 2020 - Crafting Procedural Assets for Unity and Unreal | H18

56187691271485.author: Johannes Richter
56187691271485.description: CONTROL features a lot of reactive environments and destruction. The talk outlines the procedural workflows used to build the rich and engaging environments and the use of Houdini in the process.
56187691271485.name: Presentation - HIVE GameDev 2020 - Creating Reactive Environments for CONTROL | H18

56187691271486.author: Paul Ambrosiussen
56187691271486.description: A highlight of the changes to the toolset since last years GDC! Find out what the new tools are, how we've re-branded the GameDevelopmentToolset to SideFXLabs, and some other new improvements.
56187691271486.name: Presentation - HIVE GameDev 2020 - From GameDevToolset to SideFXLabs | H18

56187691271487.author: Paul Ambrosiussen
56187691271487.description: WFC algorithm can greatly increase your workflow in bitmap generation, level generation and overall content creation. In this talk we will explore how to expand upon this using Houdini's massive toolkit of built-in tools. Also how you can use PDG to parallelize content creation.
56187691271487.name: Presentation - HIVE GameDev 2020 - WaveFunctionCollapse Supercharged with PDG for Level Generation | H18

56187691271488.author: Patrick McAvena
56187691271488.description: A behind-the-scenes look at how Houdini was used to generate level art for an isometric game developed in UE4. This talk will showcase techniques for automatically exporting 3D grid data from Unreal and importing it into Houdini to generate fully-realized levels.
56187691271488.name: Presentation - HIVE GameDev 2020 - Procedural Modelling For Grid-Based Games | H18

56187691271489.author: Jerome Hereng
56187691271489.description: Procedural building and siege weapon destruction for the Microsoft game: Age of Empire II Definitive Edition, using a tool we created within Houdini FX. Our tool took advantage of Houdini's ability to create complex simulated effects using constraints.
56187691271489.name: Presentation - HIVE GameDev 2020 - Age of Empire II Definitive Edition, Using a Tool Created in Houdini FX | H18

56187691271490.author: Thomas Tobin
56187691271490.description: Thomas will be covering reconstructing game data in Houdini, pipeline tools to create an asset bank, Custom LOD HDA, PDG destruction testing.
56187691271490.name: Presentation - HIVE GameDev 2020 - Procedural Tools for Data Handling | H18

56187691271491.author: John Moncrief
56187691271491.description: Breaks down the new trend of SOPs based workflows for creating dynamic simulations in Houdini. Thinking behind the new Vellum, Pyro, and RBD Bullet workflows in SOPs, and how these tools work with specific 'SideFX Labs' workflows to export data for use in game engines.
56187691271491.name: Presentation - HIVE GameDev 2020 - SOP-Based Dynamics for Games | H18

56187691271492.author: Florian Gantzert & Clemens Berger
56187691271492.description: Poly-reduction of stylized hair, stylized hair workflow, going from Houdini to Unity with PDG and without Houdini Engine. They will also talk about High-to-low modeling pipeline, from ZBrush to Houdini to Substance, and Batch processing skinned meshes FBX with PDG.
56187691271492.name: Presentation - HIVE GameDev 2020 - Get Rid Of The Boring In Your Pipeline: How We Got Started | H18

56187691271493.author: Caitlyn Trout
56187691271493.description: Destruction techniques used for creating game-ready assets. Covers problems that were experienced during production and what subnetworks and tools were created to solve them.
56187691271493.name: Presentation - HIVE GameDev 2020 - Destruction Tools and Techniques Used For Borderlands 3 | H18

56187691271494.author: Robert Magee
56187691271494.description: Robert explores how easy it is to understand 'Houdini-speak' while introducing the different ways that a node-based procedural workflow can support your gamedev projects. Learn about different types of nodes, networks and assets that you can create in Houdini.
56187691271494.name: Presentation - HIVE GameDev 2020 - The Secret Language of Houdini for Games | H18

56187691271495.author: Maria Mishurenko
56187691271495.description: Maria shares tips and tricks for improving virtual reality game development workflows such as making concept art sketches, optimizing visual effects, generating procedural characters, rapidly iterating on level designs and even creating and rendering game key art.
56187691271495.name: Presentation - HIVE GameDev 2020 - Tips and tricks for improving VR Game Dev Workflows | H18

56187691271496.author: Mai Ao
56187691271496.description: Lessons learned at Schell Games where we developed an art-directable, high-performance crowd pipeline from Houdini to Unreal that can render thousands of characters in real time. Also delves into the investment and return of creating a pipeline of HDAs to streamline destruction workflow.
56187691271496.name: Presentation - HIVE GameDev 2020 - It Just Needs to Work On Paper - Houdini R&D for Real-time | H18

56187691271497.author: Thomas Tobin
56187691271497.description: Workshop on creating your own PyPanel HDA's and quality of life tips and tricks.
56187691271497.name: Presentation - HIVE GameDev 2020 - Make your Artists Love You | H18

56187691271498.author: Kristian Kebbe
56187691271498.description: A breakdown of how Houdini is being used as the primary DCC for creating game assets in Lucen, a solo developed indie title. From modeling, to animation, to VFX and Houdini engine, covers the ins and outs of how Houdini is being used in all facets of Lucen's game asset creation.
56187691271498.name: Presentation - HIVE GameDev 2020 - Lucen: Indie gamedev with Houdini and UE4 | H18

56187691271499.author: Tyler Bay
56187691271499.description: Introduction to the lessons and explore the shaderbot scene file that will be used to create the materials. The shaderbot includes a series of switch nodes for choosing different backdrops, HDRIs and Key Light setups to make it easy to examine how each material looks.
56187691271499.name: Long Tutorial - Shading Theory with Karma [Multi-part Series] | H18

56187691271500.author: Andreas Glad
56187691271500.description: Basics of vertex color gradient based animation for Unreal Engine 4. Vertex color gradient animation is the practice of creating animation using vertex shader offsets with various math functions modulated by the vertex colors.
56187691271500.name: Long Tutorial - Vertex Color Based Animation Basics | H18

56187691271501.author: Justin Dykhouse
56187691271501.description: Workflow for creating works on paper using Houdini and a robotic pen plotter. He'll discuss creating designs in Houdini, converting to scalable vector graphics files (SVG), preparing designs for the plotter, and the printing process.
56187691271501.name: Presentation - LAHUG - Using Houdini to Create Works on Paper | H18

56187691271502.author: Mihnea Stoica
56187691271502.description: Mihnea Stoica presents his work on generating procedural character animations within Houdini's channel operator context known as CHOPs.
56187691271502.name: Presentation - LA HUG - Generating Procedural Motion Using CHOPs | H18

56187691271503.author: Emily Fung
56187691271503.description: SideFX intern Emily Fung shares some of her soft-bodies workflow tips using FEM -incl two examples, showcasing how to prepare clean simulation-ready geometry, common FEM constraints workflows and a few interesting tips + tricks.
56187691271503.name: Presentation - Toronto HUG - Soft-body FEM Workflow Tips | H18

56187691271504.author: Simon Verstraete
56187691271504.description: Learn how to create a procedural Level Builder that uses a single curve to create the walls, ceiling and floor along with doors and props.
56187691271504.name: Long Tutorial - Sci-Fi Scene: Level Builder [4-Part Series] | H18

56187691271505.author: Yuqing Chen
56187691271505.description: SideFX intern Yuqing Chen gives an introduction to Solaris in Houdini 18, including several examples showing the process of preparing assets, setting variants, and physical editing.
56187691271505.name: Presentation - H18 Solaris | H18

56187691271506.author: Kays Alatrakchi
56187691271506.description: Director and VFX Artist Kays Alatrakchi shows how Redshift played a key role in his latest music video, 'Thursday Night'. Kays will discuss the integration of Redshift within Houdini, his workflow pipeline, and show different shading techniques used in the creation of his work.
56187691271506.name: Presentation - LA HUG - Houdini and Redshift | H18

56187691271507.author: Simon Verstraete
56187691271507.description: Start with a sphere then divide it into panels using a voronoi pattern. You will model two different kinds of panels then add color and detail for use later in texture maps.
56187691271507.name: Long Tutorial - Sci-Fi Scene: Core [4-Part Series] | H18

56187691271508.author: Simon Verstraete
56187691271508.description: Now that the staircase is ready, learn how wrap up the network into a Houdini Digital Asset then promote parameters to the top level to build the UI for Unity. You will work to control all aspects of the asset that will help your level designers customize the stair for your game.
56187691271508.name: Long Tutorial - Sci-Fi Scene: Stair Generator [3-Part Series] | H18

56187691271509.author: Michael Goldfarb
56187691271509.description: Topics covered include updates on our previous character asset created in the first series; capturing geometry in general, bones and capture parameters, capture and deform regions, capture pose vs capture frame, aligning capture pose, capture types.
56187691271509.name: Long Tutorial - Rigging: Series 2 | H18

56187691271510.author: Simon Verstraete
56187691271510.description: Create a procedural asset for a sci fi game level that includes a computer terminal and fuel tank elements. Start by exploring the finished asset - giving you an idea of where this lesson is headed and lets you explore the flexibility of this game asset wrapped up as a Houdini Digital Asset.
56187691271510.name: Long Tutorial - Sci-Fi Scene: Terminal and Tanks [5-Part Series] | H18

56187691271511.author: Simon Verstraete
56187691271511.description: Learn how to create a functioning door asset that can be used to rapidly add doors to a level. Each of the doors will be consistent with the design aesthetic of the level, while allowing your designers to customize the shape, size and detailing on a door to door basis.
56187691271511.name: Long Tutorial - Sci-Fi Scene: Door Generator [4-Part Series] | H18

56187691271512.author: Rohan Dalvi
56187691271512.description: An introduction to Houdini - including some of H18's newest features.
56187691271512.name: Long Tutorial - Intro to Houdini 18 [5-Part Series] | H18

56187691271513.author: Rohan Dalvi
56187691271513.description: Create a box of cupcakes using procedural modeling techniques in Houdini. You will then assign materials and textures and use the Solaris context [LOPS] to set up the shot for lookdev, layout, lighting and rendering with Karma.
56187691271513.name: Long Tutorial - Cupcake Project [10-Part Series] | H18

56187691271514.author: Matt Ebb
56187691271514.description: You don't always have the resources of a big team and budget, but with the right techniques Houdini can help you do more with less. Matt shows some tips and tricks used while working in production, to help manage a larger scope as a small team or freelancer.
56187691271514.name: Presentation - SIGGRAPH ASIA 2019 - Doing Big Work with a Small Team | H17.5

56187691271515.author: Luke Gravett
56187691271515.description: A retrospective look at the challenges and advantages of using the Solaris Lookdev, Layout and Lighting tools on a full-feature production at Animal Logic.
56187691271515.name: Presentation - SIGGRAPH ASIA 2019 - SideFX Solaris: A Production Perspective | H17.5

56187691271516.author: Dan Wills
56187691271516.description: Reaction-Diffusion is a fascinating type of simulation in which the the concentrations of multiple diffusing chemical species in a reaction is simulated spatially, for example on a pixel or voxel array.
56187691271516.name: Presentation - SIGGRAPH ASIA 2019 - Fun with Reaction-Diffusion in Houdini | H17.5

56187691271517.author: Andrew Graham
56187691271517.description: Open Firehawk is an initiative by Andrew Graham to automate direct access to cloud infrastructure at lower cost and with more control than prior solutions were able to offer.
56187691271517.name: Presentation - SIGGRAPH ASIA 2019 - Open Firehawk: Hybrid Open Cloud Infrastructure & PDG | H17.5

56187691271518.author: Nick Petit
56187691271518.description: Houdini 18 introduces a number of new RBD workflow tools to enhance and simplify the creation of Bullet simulations from within SOPs. SideFX's Nick Petit walks through the new tools using practical (and some less practical!) examples.
56187691271518.name: Presentation - SIGGRAPH ASIA 2019 - New RBD Workflow Tools in Houdini 18 | H17.5

56187691271519.author: Matt Estela
56187691271519.description: In Part 2 (no really this time) of the 'Houdini: You're Learning It Wrong' series, Matt covers the technical pitfalls, workflow and incorrect assumptions people make when jumping from another package (eg Maya) to Houdini.
56187691271519.name: Presentation - SIGGRAPH ASIA 2019 - Houdini: You're learning it wrong (no really this time) | H17.5

56187691271520.author: Nick Angus
56187691271520.description: Alt VFX's Nick Angus covers transitioning a studio's pipeline to Houdini. Alt started with an amazing commercial, then reality sunk in that they were limited by 'off the shelf' tools, and new jobs brought a huge variety of needs - so they started to look at Houdini.
56187691271520.name: Presentation - SIGGRAPH ASIA 2019 - Punching Above Your Weight | H17.5

56187691271521.author: Adam Katz
56187691271521.description: Hear insights on how Animal Logic builds and automates their Character FX pipeline. When production began on Peter Rabbit in 2017, Animal Logic had the unique opportunity to build their Character FX cloth and fur toolset from scratch.
56187691271521.name: Presentation - SIGGRAPH ASIA 2019 - Intelligent Setups for Automating Character FX | H17.5

56187691271522.author: Simon Verstraete
56187691271522.description: Learn how to create a procedural Sci Fi Crate Generator in Houdini that can be used to create custom props for game engines such as Unity and Unreal.
56187691271522.name: Long Tutorial - Sci Fi Crates [4-part series] | H18

56187691271523.author: John Moncrief
56187691271523.description: Explore some of the key nodes and concepts for working with Vellum including Configuring Vellum objects, creating collisions, understanding constraints, and the 'Post Solve' workflow.
56187691271523.name: Long Tutorial - VELLUM: Workflow Concepts | H18

56187691271524.author: Simon Verstraete
56187691271524.description: This overview shows you the finished asset and its various controls work in both Houdini and in Unity. You will learn what kinds of parameters are available and how you can turn a Photoshop file with multiple layers into a quality game-ready model.
56187691271524.name: Long Tutorial - Sci Fi Panel Generator [3-Part Series] | H17.5

56187691271525.author: Simon Verstraete
56187691271525.description: Learn how to make a house generator based on modular models. The tutorial is for intermediate users of Houdini.
56187691271525.name: Long Tutorial - Building Generator | H17.5

56187691271526.author: Louis-Philippe Clavet
56187691271526.description: This 3-part workshop covers the key concepts of a usual crowd workflow. Starting with rigging we see how to draw bones, capture a geometry and create a digital asset from our rig. Then, we animate our character, set up agents and simulate the crowd. Finally, we will light, shade and render our scene.
56187691271526.name: Presentation - SIGGRAPH 2019 - Crowd Workshop - 3 Parts: Rigging / Agents & Simulation / Shading & Rendering | H17.5

56187691271527.author: Scott Keating
56187691271527.description: SideFX's Scott Keating showcases the upcoming SideFX Solaris at SIGGRAPH 2019. Solaris brings a new context called LOPS, or lighting operators, that brings native USD [Universal Scene Description] support to Houdini to allow for comprehensive lookdev, layout and lighting workflows.
56187691271527.name: Presentation - SIGGRAPH 2019 - Solaris Reveal | H18

56187691271528.author: John Moncrief
56187691271528.description: The Houdini Vellum toolset introduces a streamlined approach to creating cloth, grain, string, and soft body simulations. John walks through practical introductory applications of the Vellum toolset - and discusses the implementation of useful workflows for multiple parts of the pipeline, including production methodology for artists using either Houdini FX or Houdini Core.
56187691271528.name: Presentation - SIGGRAPH 2019 - Vellum Unveiled | H17.5

56187691271529.author: Matt Estela
56187691271529.description: With so many learning resources, it must be easy to learn Houdini and get a job right? Having spent years writing CGWiki, looking at hundreds of reels, hiring lots of artists, and teaching Houdini at the UTS AL Academy, Matt has thought about what defines a strong FX artist. Using examples from his students, he breaks down essential skills, and how to demo them in a reel.
56187691271529.name: Presentation - SIGGRAPH 2019 - Learning Houdini: You're Doing It Wrong and How to do it Right | H17.5

56187691271530.author: Oliver Markowski
56187691271530.description: Oliver will show you two techniques that made the procedural shading workflow at RISE much more efficient. First, he will talk about old-school texture-bombing. Even though this technique has been around for decades, it is under-utilized because there is no support for it in any renderer. In the second part, learn how RISE implemented automated texture-baking for large scale scenes.
56187691271530.name: Presentation - SIGGRAPH 2019 - Two tricks to make your Procedural Shading Workflow more Efficient | H17.5

56187691271531.author: Matt Battaglia
56187691271531.description: Dive into the lessons learned during the development of Mortal Kombat 11. We will focus on our geometry cache pipeline to leverage Houdini's fluid simulation tools to drive our unique cinematic blood effects. As a studio new to Houdini, we give a BTS look at some of our assets and share a little bit of the wisdom we've gained while ramping up on Houdini over a two year dev cycle.
56187691271531.name: Presentation - SIGGRAPH 2019 - Mortal Kombat 11: A Bloody Production Talk | H17.5

56187691271532.author: Pouyan Navid
56187691271532.description: Pouyan demonstrates how Method created organic looking spider webs from scratch for Spider-Man commercials. He covers creating the geometry with curves, web shooting animation, dynamic simulation to show weight and movement and finally making shaders and rendering it.
56187691271532.name: Presentation - SIGGRAPH 2019 - Spider-Man's Webs: His most Valuable Superpower | H17.5

56187691271533.author: Fianna Wong
56187691271533.description: Fianna delivers a smorgasbord of stuff that is currently cooking in the SideFX dev kitchen - modeling, UI and god knows what else. Sometimes you smell burning, but other times we also get pastry too!
56187691271533.name: Presentation - SIGGRAPH 2019 - CG Blacksmithing | H17.5

56187691271534.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271534.description: An overview of the various tools the GameDev Team has been working on, including how the team's dev process has evolved over the years. Luiz also makes a few surprise announcements and reveals the future of the Game Development Toolset. Finally, he explores some of the ways artists can leverage the game dev tools in both film and television projects.
56187691271534.name: Presentation - SIGGRAPH 2019 - 'Game' Development Tools | H17.5

56187691271535.author: Rob Stauffer
56187691271535.description: Universal Scene Description (USD) is open source software designed to make it easier to 'interchange and augment arbitrary 3D scenes that may be composed from many elemental assets.' This will have a profound effect on how studios build pipelines in the future and with SideFX Solaris working natively with USD, it will be an important part of working with Houdini.
56187691271535.name: Presentation - SIGGRAPH 2019 - What is USD: A Primer | H18

56187691271536.author: Robert Magee
56187691271536.description: Houdini gives artists a procedural pipeline-in-a-box experience. Robert introduces the nodes, networks and assets that define the core of this workflow which allows for multiple iterations and changes deep in production. He also explores how tools such as Houdini Engine and PDG let you build a studio-level solution that makes proceduralism available to the whole pipeline.
56187691271536.name: Presentation - SIGGRAPH 2019 - Houdini Foundations: Pipeline in a Box | H17.5

56187691271537.author: Jorge Razon
56187691271537.description: Jorge showcases some of the dynamics simulations done by Soho VFX. Using Houdini's highly customizable procedural workflow allowed Soho to develop unique effects including the 'Bamf' and 'Entity' for Dark Phoenix.
56187691271537.name: Presentation - SIGGRAPH 2019 - Enter the Phoenix | H17.5

56187691271538.author: Jeroen Lapre
56187691271538.description: Jeroen talks about science-based storytelling for planetarium show production, and other media at the Academy. The 'VIZ' Studio adapts tools and techniques from the film production, visual effects, digital animation, and real time computer graphics industries; to produce science media that is accessible to the general public.
56187691271538.name: Presentation - SIGGRAPH 2019 - Science-Based Storytelling in Planetarium Show Production & Other Digital Media | H17.5

56187691271539.author: Paul Ambrosiussen
56187691271539.description: SideFX Game TA, Paul Ambrosiussen, provides insights into how the Maps Baker replicates the functionality of the bake_texture node using nothing but VEX - all from inside COPs. Waiting for renders massively slows down iteration times, which is one of the primary reasons the tool was built: fast, high-quality map baking.
56187691271539.name: Presentation - LAHUG - Baking Texture & Masking Maps at Lightspeed! | H17.5

56187691271540.author: Jorge Razon
56187691271540.description: Jorge talks about what he and his team at Soho VFX have done on GoT. Jorge Razon is a VFX Supervisor at Soho VFX. He's been working in the industry since 2002 - completing over 40 feature films, including 'Logan', 'Wonder Woman' and 'In Time'.
56187691271540.name: Presentation - THUG - Game of Thrones | H17.5

56187691271541.author: Niels Prayer
56187691271541.description: Through a retrospective of several works he did and more recent ones, Niels describes his way of thinking about image, the importance of sound, and how he's using Houdini in different ways, from pure motion design to more art projects integrated with his piano works.
56187691271541.name: Presentation - Paris HIVE 19 - From Motion to Emotion | H17.5

56187691271542.author: Mikael Pettersen
56187691271542.description: MPC's Mikael Pettersen talks about how and why the crowd department at MPC switched from their proprietary crowds system to Houdini.
56187691271542.name: Presentation - Paris HIVE 19 - Houdini Crowds at MPC | H17.5

56187691271543.author: Maxime Hacquard
56187691271543.description: Maxime will display how to take advantage of Houdini for creating 3D motion design. It will be focused on its simplest use for fast and efficient results.
56187691271543.name: Presentation - Paris HIVE 19 - Creative Ways of Using Houdini for Motion Graphics | H17.5

56187691271544.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271544.description: Jeff takes you through the basics of oceans in Houdini - including small and large ocean tools, guided ocean simulations, white water, and more.
56187691271544.name: Presentation - Paris HIVE 19 - Houdini Oceans | H17.5

56187691271545.author: Benoit Martinez
56187691271545.description: Working on the Ghost Recon franchise, Benoit and his team developed around Houdini an innovative and dedicated toolchain to shape the world and produce a wide variety of environments. This lecture will describe the techniques and technology behind this work and how they gave the artists the right tools to control large scale landscapes and small details. He'll explain the procedural approach they adopted to create terrain, roads, forests, rivers and settlements, and how all those tools are connected to each other. He'll provide an overview of the tools and also the dedicated Houdini pipeline developed over years to create AAA game environments at Ubisoft Paris.
56187691271545.name: Presentation - Paris HIVE 19 - Building Worlds with Houdini | H17.5

56187691271546.author: Andriy Bilichenko
56187691271546.description: Andriy will introduce the procedural features of building a hair system for a lion. He will explain why grooming artists do not need to try to recreate the usual methods of grooming, known to them from other 3D packages. He will show procedural methods of forming hairstyles for human characters and introduce some tricks and tips.
56187691271546.name: Presentation - Paris HIVE 19 - Houdini as the Best Software for 3D Grooming | H17.5

56187691271547.author: Paul Parneix
56187691271547.description: 3D and surface scanning solutions are more and more accesible for games and VFX studios, but crafting a production-ready asset from a raw scan can be quite challenging. Paul will share his expertise on photogrammetry and photommetric-stereo techniques, and show how Houdini can help at different steps of the workflow to make things easier in the scope of building production ready assets. He'll also show how the new Houdini PDG system can be used to run and unify the different steps of the pipeline.
56187691271547.name: Presentation - Paris HIVE 19 - Houdini & 3D / Surface Scanning Workflows | H17.5

56187691271548.author: Moritz Schwind & Henry Foster
56187691271548.description: Moritz and Henry walk through the suite of tools they developed to help with common motion graphics tasks in Houdini. The workflow and interface should seem familiar to users of other motion graphics software packages, but it's using Houdini-friendly workflows under the hood for more experienced Houdini artists. MOPs is both a ready-to-use toolkit and a framework for constructing your own operators more easily.
56187691271548.name: Presentation - Intro to Motion Operators (MOPs) | H17.5

56187691271549.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271549.description: SideFX's Jeff Wagner - Senior Production Consultant - provides a high level overview of the efficiencies gained by using proceduralism in the pipeline, and why PDG was conceived to solve pipeline dependency challenges. Jeff is joined by Ken Xu - Senior Software Architect, PDG and Engine - plus software developers Chris Grebeldinger and Taylor Petrick.
56187691271549.name: Webinar - Evolving Pipelines with PDG | H17.5

56187691271550.author: Mark Spevick
56187691271550.description: Learn how to quickly set up and render a burning tree effect. You will set up the Pyro FX flames using shelf tools and then use OpenCL to speed up the simulation. You will also learn how to adjust the fuel source to get a nice look for your simulation. You will then work with the Pyro shader and set up the shot for rendering to disk.
56187691271550.name: Long Tutorial - Houdini Pyro FX (Series) | H17.5

56187691271551.author: Rob Stauffer
56187691271551.description: In this short video, I show you how you can take a directory of objects, poly reduce them and bake the textures using TOPS.
56187691271551.name: Quick Tutorial - Process Multiple Objects with TOPS | H17.5

56187691271552.author: Fuat Yueksel
56187691271552.description: RISE FX's Fuat Yueksel takes you through a few of his favourite new features of Houdini 17.5 - with a focus on RBD Constraint Tools (from Lines, Curves and Rules) - and Vellum Tetrahedral Fiber Constraints (Volume, Fiber, !FEM).
56187691271552.name: Presentation - MucHUG - Houdini 17.5 Features | H17.5

56187691271553.author: Luca Scheller
56187691271553.description: LYNX tool developer Luca Schiller takes you through his first three tools.
56187691271553.name: Presentation - MucHUG - LYNX Tools | H17.5

56187691271554.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271554.description: Houdini 17.5 is out and has some nice new features to help TDs and TAs do their day to day work. There will be an exploration of new and modified SOPs and other node types, UI improvements, VEX and scripting updates, and of course PilotPDG and TOPs are bound to be on the list. All the features will be related to production needs so you can take advantage of these features in your work and tools.
56187691271554.name: Presentation - FMX 19 - Top Five Features in Houdini 17.5 | H17.5

56187691271555.author: Sarah Forcier
56187691271555.description: Learn about Pixar's brand new RenderMan for Houdini plugin, completely rewritten to support the latest interactive workflows in RenderMan. Sarah Forcier will demonstrate RenderMan's greatly improved integration with Houdini, including interactive modeling, shading, and lighting. Sarah will also highlight features like seamless support for Houdini's geometric attributes, and the addition of Pixar's powerful Preset Browser. Come check out this great new release, and you'll get a RenderMan Limited Enamel Pin for FMX 2019!
56187691271555.name: Presentation - FMX 19 - Renderman for Houdini | H17.5

56187691271556.author: Tim van Helsdingen
56187691271556.description: Houdini use is getting more and more prominent within both bigger and smaller studios. As a freelancer I work for a lot of different studios. Both on-site and remote. It's interesting to see the increased use, but also the different integration of the software in the pipeline (or lack thereof). Will talk a bit about that, show some interesting projects I worked on, talk about managing stress & avoiding burnout, how I got into doing freelance Houdini work ...and some additional rambling.
56187691271556.name: Presentation - FMX 19 - #FREELANCETHUGLIFE | H17.5

56187691271557.author: Alexander Dimov & Angel Ivanov
56187691271557.description: Worldwide FX's Angel Ivanov and Red Ring's Alexander Dimov provide an overview of the FX work in 'Hellboy' - focusing on one of the key effects involving a supernatural portal to another dimension. Prepare to face all of nature's elements and then some!
56187691271557.name: Presentation - FMX 19 - Hellboy: A Look Into the FX | H17.5

56187691271558.author: Simon Holmedal
56187691271558.description: Bringing the power of houdini to the world of motion design through curated procedural systems.
56187691271558.name: Presentation - FMX 19 - Curated Motion Design with Houdini | H17.5

56187691271559.author: Ahmed Gharraph
56187691271559.description: What does it take to create photo-realistic furry creatures? We will try to answer that question by looking back at some of the recent creatures that have come through Framestore IA, and exploring the various grooming techniques we have developed in our department.
56187691271559.name: Presentation - FMX 19 - Creatures in Houdini | H17.5

56187691271560.author: Simon French
