56187691271560.description: What do you do when you need to shoot a plane taking off in a storm and then flying through beautiful fluffy clouds at golden hour, but you don't have a plane, a helicopter, a runway, or control of the weather? We take you through from concept and previs to final shots.
56187691271560.name: Presentation - FMX 19 - Virgin - Depart The Everyday | H17.5

56187691271561.author: Keith Kamholz
56187691271561.description: Houdini 17/17.5 include a number of excellent updates/additions to destruction workflows. In this presentation, Keith will discuss how his preferred destruction workflow has evolved with these new features. He'll also compare bespoke techniques to built-in solutions & use the example scene from his recently revamped CGMA 'Mastering Destruction in Houdini' class to demonstrate some of these techniques.
56187691271561.name: Presentation - FMX 19 - Evolving Destruction Workflows | H17.5

56187691271562.author: Rajendra Khirodkar
56187691271562.description: SideFX Environment Artist intern Rajendra Khirodkar demonstrates one approach to Terrain Generation Workflow in Houdini, showing the latest Heightfield tools like HF Erode 2.0 and HF Scatter 2.0. He also covers the techniques used in his Island project, such as generating and laying out island geometry, non-destructive and 'collision-aware' scattering, as well as shading and rendering.
56187691271562.name: Presentation - THUG - Terrain Tools | H17.5

56187691271563.author: Paul Ambrosiussen
56187691271563.description: Paul gives a high-level overview of the Houdini tools that have been developed to create a rapid iteration workflow for using sketches, created in a paint application to generate 3D game levels in multiple styles for mobile games. Using this workflow the SideFX Games Team created a mobile game in Unity called 'Drawy McTank Face' :)
56187691271563.name: Presentation - GDC 19 - Rapid Level Creation for Unity Mobile | H17.5

56187691271564.author: Ari Danesh
56187691271564.description: Ari explores Houdini's terrain tools with a focus on new erosion models for higher quality results and hierarchical scattering for populating the terrain. He will also look at ways that Machine Learning can be utilized to take terrain generation to the next level.
56187691271564.name: Presentation - GDC 19 - Terrain Generation | H17.5

56187691271565.author: Rob Stauffer
56187691271565.description: Rob shows how to rapidly create variants of game assets using Houdini's procedural workflow and the new Procedural Dependency Graph (PDG). Explore methods for generating textures and geometry by iterating over value ranges using wedging. Learn how to using Houdini Engine and Houdini's pipeline tools for efficient batch processing, and see the resulting assets in Unreal Engine.
56187691271565.name: Presentation - GDC 19 - PDG Automation Pipeline: Make More Assets | H17.5

56187691271566.author: Luis Garcia
56187691271566.description: Learn how speed up your 3D workflows while maintaining asset quality, build large scenes, or achieve a high number of asset variations. In this session, Luiz show you how to get the most from Houdini Engine in your game development, and how to speed up repetitive tasks by creating Digital Assets that integrate directly into the game engine as fully functional assets.
56187691271566.name: Presentation - GDC 19 - Simplifying Indie GameDev Workflows | H17.5

56187691271567.author: Luiz Kruel & Galen Davis
56187691271567.description: Luiz and Galen take you behind the scenes of the making of Rebirth - the short film by Quixel, SideFX and Epic - launched at GDC 2019. Rebirth demonstrates that using a film quality approach in a real-time setting is achievable in Unreal Engine using high quality scan data. Leveraging the power of Houdini under the hood, coupled with Megascans and LIDAR on top, the production team proved that small team of artists can achieve insanely high quality results in a short amount of time.
56187691271567.name: Presentation - GDC 19 - Scan Data & Procedural Workflows: Behind the Scenes of Rebirth | H17.5

56187691271568.author: Mike Lyndon
56187691271568.description: Mike gives a quick overview of the various tools the SideFX gamedev team has been working on recently - including an updated gameres pipeline with Alice Vision (photogrammetry) and LOD generation, a building generator, and some procedural VFX tools. He outlines the development cycle and how you contribute to that as well as our roadmap for the year ahead.
56187691271568.name: Presentation - GDC 19 - H17.5 GameDev Tools Update | H17.5

56187691271569.author: David Santiago
56187691271569.description: David gives an overview of the how Houdini helped Insomniac author the ground, buildings, traffic, vignettes and crimes, props, and impostors, audio, lighting and more for Marvel's Spider-Man.
56187691271569.name: Presentation - GDC 19 - Marvel's Spider-Man, meet Houdini | H17.5

56187691271570.author: Ben House
56187691271570.description: Ben covers a wide range of benefits of using Houdini as a studio-wide pipeline tool in gamedev. He covers powerful terrain and VFX tools, and multiple ways that Houdini and Houdini Engine are used to increase studio efficiency by reducing boring or repetitive tasks that frequently take time away from artists. Bluepoint has led the remastering process for years, releasing many iconic titles, including the God of War Collection, Uncharted: the Nathan Drake Collection, and most recently, Shadow of the Colossus on PS4.
56187691271570.name: Presentation - GDC 19 - Houdini as a Comprehensive Gamedev Tool | H17.5

56187691271571.author: Stephen Tucker
56187691271571.description: While Houdini is often thought of as a power house for simulation, the low level access it offers when constructing geometry is without a doubt one of its most attractive features for game development. Stephen provides a look at some of the ways in which Houdini has been used to create and manipulate geometry in Darwin Project for static meshes of lavafalls / splashes / rivers, rendered meshes as textures for Unreal Engine particles, collision meshes and vertex animated meshes.
56187691271571.name: Presentation - GDC 19 - On the Origin of Darwin Project's Geometry by Means of Houdini | H17.5

56187691271572.author: Elvar Oern Unnporsson
56187691271572.description: When tight level design is king, Houdini is a Swiss Army knife for smaller teams. Elvar provides an overview of the process Flashbulb Games uses to create the large open world environments found in the open-world vehicle building game Trailmakers.
56187691271572.name: Presentation - GDC 19 - Building Worlds in Unity | H17.5

56187691271573.author: Valentine Kozin
56187691271573.description: Valentine gives a comprehensive look at the adoption of Houdini by Tech Art while working on Sea of Thieves. 'Although we only began to learn and apply Houdini mid-way through production, it proved an invaluable tool in the Tech Art toolbelt. This talk explores the deepening link in our workflow between shader development and Houdini tooling with detailed breakdowns of specific use-cases, including lightning strikes, kraken tentacles, vomit and clouds.'
56187691271573.name: Presentation - GDC 19 - Sea of Thieves: Tech Art and Shader Development | H17.5

56187691271574.author: Danicka Oglesby
56187691271574.description: Danicka talks about the different Houdini tools and techniques that she used to create a stylized VR environment in Unity. She also discusses how she processes crowd data in Houdini to be imported and used at runtime to transform agents in-engine.
56187691271574.name: Presentation - GDC 19 - Creating Assets and Crowds for Unity | H17.5

56187691271575.author: Will Driscoll / Danilo Moura Silva
56187691271575.description: Will and Danilo share their expertise and tips on photogrammetry and volumetric video, capturing several rare artifacts and tombs from Ancient Egypt from Experius VR's interactive King Tut experience - then sharing the volumetric production of '7 Miracles' - and lastly diving into the development of volumetric tools for VR and AR. Danilo takes you through the best practices for yielding great results and tips within Reality Capture, while Will demonstrates how Houdini is used to clean up and optimize photogrammetry assets for game. They also explore volumetric video and show how Houdini provides the solutions needed to manage this content in today's production world.
56187691271575.name: Presentation - GDC 19 - Photogrammetry & Volumetric Video Techniques | H17.5

56187691271576.author: Kenny Lammers
56187691271576.description: Kenny walks through the fundamentals of using Houdini to create procedural systems to rapidly generate Large Scale Environments. Learn how to optimize Houdini Engine and PDG [Procedural Dependency Graph ] workflows into your game environment creation pipelines!
56187691271576.name: Presentation - GDC 19 - Building a Large Scale Environment PDG Pipeline (Series) | H17.5

56187691271577.author: Robert Magee
56187691271577.description: Robert shows you how Houdini Engine plug-ins for Unity and UE4 let you bring Houdini's 'pipeline-in-a-box' into your game engine for increased flexibility as you build digital environments and design levels. These techniques will be explored along with the new PDG [Procedural Dependency Graph] tools that make it easier to scale up and create more content faster than ever before.
56187691271577.name: Presentation - GDC 19 - Houdini Engine & Pipeline Tools [PDG] | H17.5

56187691271578.author: Thomas Iche
56187691271578.description: How Unity's Visual Effects team designed simple exporters to bake high-definition volumes and point caches from Houdini for import into Unity for use in Visual Effect Graph.
56187691271578.name: Presentation - GDC 19 - Houdini Tools for Unity VFX Graph | H17.5

56187691271579.author: Cosku Turhan
56187691271579.description: Cosku covers how Magnopus used Houdini to edit, add FX to, and relight Holocapture volumetric data to use in the Blade Runner 2049 VR project. He will also talk about how his team used Houdini to optimize, process and export really big scenes that they got from Pixar to render the COCO VR experience. Magnopus uses Houdini extensively in their pipeline, including: fluid particle sims, procedural city generation, 4D capture processing and relighting, mesh decimation, baking textures and lighting on realtime assets, point cloud import/export, crowd sims, projection mapping, and procedural modeling using Houdini Engine in Unity & Unreal.
56187691271579.name: Presentation - GDC 19 - Bladerunner 2049 & Coco VR | H17.5

56187691271580.author: Fianna Wong
56187691271580.description: A sneak peek at an upcoming Houdini feature , we will explore the brand spanking new Measure SOP that can be used to calculate your surface curvature, perimeter, gradient (no, not the blending between colours but the angle of a slope) and boundary integrals (what's that, right?).  All this measuring...what can you do with it? Come to find out!
56187691271580.name: Presentation - GDC 19 - Size Matters: The New Measure SOP | H17.5

56187691271581.author: John Moncrief
56187691271581.description: John provides an introduction to procedural modelling for games, that starts with a general understanding of what is proceduralism in Houdini, and then demonstrates how to harness it when making artistic decisions as you generate models. This session introduces you to the idea of using Houdini as a 'Tool Building Tool' - with no previous Houdini experience required!
56187691271581.name: Presentation - GDC 19 - Intro to Procedural Modeling: Not Just Another Rock Generator | H17.5

56187691271582.author: Stoyan Dimitrov
56187691271582.description: Stoyan walks through how Space Ape Games evolved their tech from in-house procedural tools in Unity to using Houdini Engine. The main challenges in mobile games are performance and file size. Find out how they leveraged Houdini to develop a track generation tool that automatically populates road markings, apexes and walls depending on curvature while maintaining good vertex counts and lightmap resolution.
56187691271582.name: Presentation - GDC 19 - Procedural Race Tracks for Mobile Games | H17.5

56187691271583.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271583.description: Using the Unity-Houdini Engine plugin, Luiz demonstrates a pipeline that lets you make and edit PSD files in Photoshop then convert them into full playable levels in Unity. This in depth talk goes through the process of building this asset and explaining the different methods used for converting images into scatter zones, spawn point placements, terrain and more.
56187691271583.name: Presentation - GDC 19 - Photoshop Level Design in Unity using Houdini Engine | H17.5

56187691271584.author: Ari Danesh
56187691271584.description: If you are new to PDG, or are having difficulty in understanding PDG, this video is the place to start. No hands on learning is offered but rather an easy introduction explaining what PDG is, what it can be used for, and all its components such as Processes, Work Items, and Schedulers.
56187691271584.name: Presentation - PDG | Conceptual Introduction | H17.5

56187691271585.author: Kenny Lammers
56187691271585.description: Welcome to Introduction to PDG for Indie Game Developers.  In this tutorial series we are going to walk through the entire process of using Side FX's latest addition to Houdini, TOP's and PDG!  This technology allows us to build large scale environments much faster than before and the best thing is we can do it all inside of the Houdini Engine for Unity.  Throughout this course you will learn how to set up a basic TOP network, how to begin to build a Procedural Level Creation system, and how to scatter massive amount of foliage onto your levels.  We will even take a look at how to produce Areas and Roads for our level.  By the end of this course you will have the beginning of a complete Procedural Level creation system and the foundational knowledge needed to become successful with PDG, TOP's, and the Houdini Engine for Unity! This lesson is part of a larger collection of tutorials which you can access here along with project files: https://www.sidefx.com/learn/collections/pdg-for-indie-gamedev/
56187691271585.name: Presentation - PDG for Indie Gamedev (Series) | H17.5

56187691271586.author: Ari Danesh
56187691271586.description: A conceptual Introduction to PDG (18:00) If you are new to PDG, or are having difficulty in understanding PDG, this video is the place to start. No hands on learning is offered but rather an easy introduction explaining what PDG is, what it can be used for, and all its components such as Processes, Work Items, and Schedulers.Space Colonization using PDG (29:00) After viewing the 'Conceptual Introduction to PDG' this video will show you how to take an existing Houdini network and convert it to a PDG workflow.
56187691271586.name: Presentation - PDG | Space Colonization | H17.5

56187691271587.author: Moritz Schwind
56187691271587.description: This hands on tutorial will show how PDG can generate multiple particle streams (wedges) utilizing multiple cores in parallel. In part 1 of this video we will discuss a general Houdini centric workflow where the Particle Stream is created with a few Objects and a Dynamics Operator Network. We will then drop down a TOP Network and use PDG to drive the particle simulation we just created.
56187691271587.name: Presentation - PDG | Particle Stream Wedging | H17.5

56187691271588.author: Moritz Schwind
56187691271588.description: PDG and TOPs are the major new features of Houdini 17.5. This tutorial will give you a quick overview of whatPDG/TOPs are and how to leverage their power in design centric workflows.
56187691271588.name: Presentation - PDG For Design Work (Series) | H17.5

56187691271589.author: Ahmed Gharraph
56187691271589.description: Ahmed digs deep into Framestore's creature archives, presenting a menagerie of characters from standout projects across the years. He discusses the challenges of creature creation, and how certain challenges were overcome using Houdini's arsenal of tools and solvers.
56187691271589.name: Presentation - Character FX & Crowds (London) - Framestore Creatures & Houdini | H17

56187691271590.author: Dan Yargici / Adam Droy
56187691271590.description: 3D Artist Dan Yargici and VFX Supervisor Adam Droy walk us through the decisions and technical processes behind The Mill's Houdini-based crowd solution, used to deliver 50+ shots for Nike's epic 'Awaken the Phantom' campaign.
56187691271590.name: Presentation - Character FX & Crowds (London) - Awakening the Crowds for Nike's 'Phantom' | H17

56187691271591.author: Hudson Martins / Camille Fourniols / Philipp Buschauer
56187691271591.description: This talk will walk through the process from deciding to use Houdini for hair simulations, feathers, fur to technical solutions and challenges as well as where we see the use of Houdini as a future main CFX tool in Axis Studios.
56187691271591.name: Presentation - Character FX & Crowds (London) - Hair, Feathers and Fur | H17

56187691271592.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271592.description: Houdini makes an excellent platform for providing all kinds of FX work on top of characters. This presentation will look at applying various different effects to characters including, dynamic fur, dynamic skin secondary effects, muscles and more. Jeff will also explore the use of the new Vellum solver for cloth, fur and jiggly stuff. Also includes a tour of the various procedural tools available to riggers and character FX TDs to see the many possibilities to pushing the boundaries of character FX work.
56187691271592.name: Presentation - Character FX & Crowds (London) - Character FX & Cloth in H17 | H17

56187691271593.author: David Deacon
56187691271593.description: David will presents an in-depth look at the TV spot 'Mountain Men: Nature's Thread', a project Lunar Animation recently completed. Covering the workflows and technical challenges involved in the creation of the piece. Set in a world made entirely of natural fibres, including the characters that are also connected to and woven from their environment.
56187691271593.name: Presentation - Character FX & Crowds (London) - Mountain Men: Nature's Thread | H17

56187691271594.author: Chris King
56187691271594.description: Presenting nineteentwenty's creature work on recent spots for Royal Marines and KFC. Chris will be focusing on the use of Houdini for the feathers from model to groom to render.
56187691271594.name: Presentation - Character FX & Crowds (London) - Feathers: From Model to Groom to Render | H17

56187691271595.author: Kai Stavginski
56187691271595.description: Kai explores examples of hair styles and challenges, and explains how to tackle them, from grooming to details & rendering.
56187691271595.name: Presentation - Character FX & Crowds (London) - Hair and Fur Grooming in H17 | H17

56187691271596.author: Masato Tsuzuki
56187691271596.description: Masato-san presents various techniques to customize the fluid solver and discussing different approaches to procedural animation to achieve cell-shading or cartoon shading look over fluid effects. [Japanese only - English captions to come later]
56187691271596.name: Presentation - SIGG Asia 18 - Making of Toon-shading Look Fluid Effects  | H17

56187691271597.author: Mark Elendt
56187691271597.description: Mark talks about how professional renderers such as Mantra work and why noise occurs during the rendering process. Mark then discusses various de-noising algorithms including the Optix denoiser that can be used with Houdini 17. [English with Japanese translation]
56187691271597.name: Presentation - SIGG Asia 18 - Houdini Rendering & De-noising | H17

56187691271598.author: Luigi Honorat
56187691271598.description: Luigi delves into how he uses Houdini to bridge the two mediums of sculpture and CGI - using computer graphics to explore new sculptural forms and ways to create. [English with Japanese translation]
56187691271598.name: Presentation - SIGG Asia 18 - The Virtual Form | H17

56187691271599.author: Junichiro Horikawa
56187691271599.description: Junichiro-san introduces an algorithmic approach for geometric design called algorithmic design using Houdini and VEX scripts, and shows the possibility of an algorithmic design such as using machine learning for geometric design. [English with Japanese translation]
56187691271599.name: Presentation - SIGG Asia 18 - Algorithmic Design with Houdini | H17

56187691271600.author: Akira Saito
56187691271600.description: Akira-san shares tips and tricks on the Voronoi tool, based on his recent personal project on hard surface design. [Japanese with English subtitles]
56187691271600.name: Presentation - SIGG Asia 18 - Procedural Hard Surface Design | H17

56187691271601.author: Rob Stauffer
56187691271601.description: Rob walks through the new MBD workflows. [English with Japanese translation]
56187691271601.name: Presentation - SIGG Asia 18 - Material-Based Dynamics | H17

56187691271602.author: Rob Stauffer
56187691271602.description: Rob walks through the new Vellum workflows. [English with Japanese translation]
56187691271602.name: Presentation - SIGG Asia 18 - Vellum Cloth | H17

56187691271603.author: Sara Rascon
56187691271603.description: Technical Artist Sara Rascon demonstrates Vellum workflows for paneling cloth, as well as draping and material lookdev. In addition, Sara does a closer look at the process that was done for the Flamenco dress which appeared in Houdini 17 sneak peek.
56187691271603.name: Presentation - Vellum Cloth Basics (from THUG) | H17

56187691271604.author: Quixel TechArt Team
56187691271604.description: Learn what's possible with the brand new SideFX Houdini integration. The SideFX Houdini Live Link is an extensive and powerful plugin that allows you to import assets from Bridge, scatter them, create custom triplanar setups, create geometry from atlases, and more.
56187691271604.name: Webinar - Quixel Bridge / Houdini Live Link | H17

56187691271605.author: Mark Spevick
56187691271605.description: In the last part, work with glue constraints and use a Bullet Soft Constraint to create bending to add realism to the shot. Also learn how to use impact data to control the wall breaking and brick clump - all for a more authentic feeling that helps bring it to life.
56187691271605.name: Quick Tutorial - Brick Smash Part 3 | Next Steps | H17

56187691271606.author: Mark Spevick
56187691271606.description: In part 2, dive into the network and explore how the contributing nodes work together to create the simulation. You will then add attributes to define some bricks as active and some as passive and use this to control how your final sim looks.
56187691271606.name: Quick Tutorial - Brick Smash Part 2 | Under the Hood | H17

56187691271607.author: Mark Spevick
56187691271607.description: Learn how to smash a brick wall starting with shelf tools then open up the network to refine the simulation. In this first part, use shelf tools to set up a Bullet RBD sim. Create the dynamics network and learn how to cache out results and load them in for fast feedback.
56187691271607.name: Quick Tutorial - Brick Smash Part 1 | Off the Shelf | H17

56187691271608.author: Luiz Kruel, Mike Lyndon + Paul Ambrosiussen
56187691271608.description: The SideFX games team's Luiz Kruel, Mike Lyndon and Paul Ambrosiussen have been crazy busy developing Houdini tools specifically designed for gamedev workflows. The guys walk through their Top 10 - including loads of tips and tricks on using the tools.
56187691271608.name: Webinar - Houdini Game Tools | H17

56187691271609.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271609.description: Houdini 17 brings a vast set of new and improved features. The big ones are Vellum, Bullet and Fracturing and a new Whitewater Solver. But it's the 'smaller' features that makes this release a stellar one for TDs and TAs.
56187691271609.name: Webinar - Jeff's Top 10 Features of H17 | H17

56187691271610.author: Cristin Barghiel & Scott Keating
56187691271610.description: SideFX's Cristin Barghiel (VP of R&D) and Scott Keating (Senior Product Designer) cover the top features of Houdini 17 at the launch event in Montreal on October 2, 2018.
56187691271610.name: Presentation - Launch: Houdini 17 Banshee | H17

56187691271611.author: Keith Kamholz
56187691271611.description: DNEG destruction specialist Keith Kamholz presents a compelling Earth FX example, incorporating a combination of terrain generation tools, crowds, RBD destruction, and more.
56187691271611.name: Long Tutorial - SIGG 18 - EARTH: Five Elements of VFX | H16.5

56187691271612.author: Scott Keating
56187691271612.description: A walk-though of the methods used to create a blossoming fire flower. We will cover managing data from geometry and particles, working with wedges, and how to customize forces to create believable non-physical effects.
56187691271612.name: Long Tutorial - SIGG 18 - FIRE: Five Elements of VFX | H16.5

56187691271613.author: Steve Knipping
56187691271613.description: Steve Knipping takes you through designing, building all of the pieces, and destroying a typical wooden boat. The lesson is crammed with a lot of techniques that you can apply to your own project/
56187691271613.name: Long Tutorial - SIGG 18 - WOOD: Five Elements of VFX | H16.5

56187691271614.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271614.description: This plugin allows you to run Reality Capture processes from within Houdini in order to streamline your pipeline. It is designed to take multiple images as input, and generate high resolutions models as the output, which can then be ran through Houdini's mesh pipeline.
56187691271614.name: Quick Tutorial - Houdini Reality Capture Plugin | H16.5

56187691271615.author: Robert Magee
56187691271615.description: For artists new to Houdini, this presentation will help you understand how particles and dynamics work within Houdini's node-based workflow. Learn how you can source geometry and use that to create Particle, Bullet Rigid Body and Pyro FX simulations.
56187691271615.name: Presentation - SIGG 18 - Houdini Foundations - Dynamics | H16.5

56187691271616.author: Panel
56187691271616.description: What makes a CG artist stand out as a 'superstar' among his or her peers? Find out in this panel discussion with studio leaders and artists.
56187691271616.name: Presentation - SIGG 18 - PANEL: What Makes a CG Superstar? | H16.5

56187691271617.author: Oliver Markowski
56187691271617.description: Learn how to quality-check your 3D models in SOPs to make sure that your texturing and rigging department will not complain about common errors. The session results in having a full-blown model-turntable rendering, with an error summary.
56187691271617.name: Presentation - SIGG 18 - Does your modelling department suck? | H16.5

56187691271618.author: John Moncrief
56187691271618.description: One of the hardest things to do is to transfer skills from one software to another especially if the interface and workflows are new to you. John makes this easier for Maya artists coming to Houdini as he explains how Houdini works from a Maya point of view.
56187691271618.name: Presentation - SIGG 18 - Houdini Concepts for the Maya Artist | H16.5

56187691271619.author: Ben Watts
56187691271619.description: Freelance artist Ben Watts discusses his personal journey into Houdini, and demonstrates intuitive ways he designs and controls FX. After that, he looks at some FX he created for studio projects.
56187691271619.name: Presentation - SIGG 18 - Design Through FX | H16.5

56187691271620.author: Robert Butterworth & Jeremy Kersey
56187691271620.description: Transformation Mask was created a team of artists, designers and engineers at Microsoft Vancouver. Robert and Jeremy cover how they leveraged Houdini's procedural nature to overcome the production challenges of fabricating the mask.
56187691271620.name: Presentation - SIGG 18 - AR Transformation Mask | H16.5

56187691271621.author: Matt Estela
56187691271621.description: The script for 'Awake' by StartVR starts with 'A beautiful glyph of light transforms in front of your eyes'. Matt shows how he used Houdini to explore that brief, how he created an art directable animated hypercube, and how he got that running in realtime VR.
56187691271621.name: Presentation - SIGG 18 - Hypercubes for VR Noobs | H16.5

56187691271622.author: Kenny Lammers
56187691271622.description: Procedural workflows are becoming a necessity in our modern game pipelines. We have to create more content while keeping the content flexible and iterative. Kenny walks through how Houdini and Houdini Engine with Unity 2018, gives artists and designers flexibility.
56187691271622.name: Presentation - SIGG 18 - Procedural Workflows with Houdini and Unity 2018 for Game Artists | H16.5

56187691271623.author: Louis Dunlevy
56187691271623.description: Learn how Houdini has been used as the primary rigging and animation tool for character animation work at Cutting Edge. Also interesting uses of the crowd system applied to some fun critters - incl insects, robots and some very Australian mammals.
56187691271623.name: Presentation - SIGG 18 - Character Adventures - Rigging, Animation and Crowds | H16.5

56187691271624.author: Kenneth Polonski
56187691271624.description: While developing their capabilities to handle large datasets, Embassy VFX came up with a deferred load workflow. In this SIGGRAPH 2018 session, Embassy's Kenneth Polonski walks through the workflow.
56187691271624.name: Presentation - SIGG 18 - Delayed Load Rendering Workflow | H16.5

56187691271625.author: Mike Lyndon
56187691271625.description: Learn how to do more with less. Distribute your work load to other teams and speed up those annoying time sinks that pull you out of your flow. Mike covers destruction workflows, UE4's Niagara integration, building tools for Maya, and more.
56187691271625.name: Presentation - SIGG 18 - The Lazy Artist's Guide to Real-time VFX | H16.5

56187691271626.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271626.description: Building HDA Gotcha's - Customizing HDAs - HDA Save Options - Managing HDAs - Versioning HDAs - HDAs and Houdini Engine - Engine HDA Design Ideas and Tips.
56187691271626.name: Webinar - HDAs & Houdini Engine | H16.5

56187691271627.author: Robert Magee
56187691271627.description: In Houdini, networks of nodes can be easily wrapped up into Houdini Digital Assets then shared with other artists. With the Houdini Engine, these assets can be loaded into the Unity game editor with procedural controls available to artists.
56187691271627.name: Presentation - Houdini Engine for Unity | H16.5

56187691271628.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271628.description: In Part 2 we will continue looking at Houdini Digital Assets or HDA construction from basics to in depth details. All live in Houdini. All the time building up HDAs to demonstrate all features.
56187691271628.name: Webinar - HDA Building - Pt 2 | H16.5

56187691271629.author: Fianna Wong
56187691271629.description: How to free-form concept hard surface geometry using predominantly Booleans, and other modeling tools within Houdini. Thanks to the non-linear workflow that Houdini allows for, you are free to try out new designs without loss of prior iterations of your design.
56187691271629.name: Presentation - Concepting Hard Surface Geometry in Houdini | H16.5

56187691271630.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271630.description: HDAs are a powerful way to turn your clever networks in to a single operator. HDAs can be simple nodes with simple uses or complex nodes that do an entire effect. The webinar looks at planning and design of networks for HDAs.
56187691271630.name: Webinar - HDA Building - Pt 1 | H16.5

56187691271631.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271631.description: The Sketchfab uploader is now available in the Game Development Toolset in Houdini. In this video, we run through the whole process of loading a model into Houdini all the way to seeing it in the browser.
56187691271631.name: Quick Tutorial - SketchFab Uploader | H16.5

56187691271632.author: Moritz Schwind, Henry aka Toadstorm
56187691271632.description: Motion graphics studios are increasingly adapting Houdini into their pipeline, so we need a versatile toolset to quickly iterate and experiment in order to meet todays client's demands. In this session, Moritz and Toadstorm give a quick intro to their newly released MOPs tools.
56187691271632.name: Presentation - Utrecht - MOPs - Motion Graphics Operators for Houdini | H16.5

56187691271633.author: David Kahl
56187691271633.description: After a brief VEX intro, David creates a demo of the VEX approach. He also showcases the features of a procedural VEX-driven sci-fi corridor generator, along with highlighting the problems that occurred during creation and how they were solved using VEX.
56187691271633.name: Presentation - Utrecht - VEX Driven Workflows | H16.5

56187691271634.author: Helge Maus
56187691271634.description: PixelTrain's Helge Maus talks about strategies of integrating Houdini FX into small boutique pipelines, shows fields in which this amazing software can help you solve day by day problems and how to approach your first projects.
56187691271634.name: Presentation - Utrecht - Adapting Houdini FX into Your Pipeline | H16.5

56187691271635.author: Mark Spevick
56187691271635.description: Pearson College / Escape Studios' Mark Spevick walks through how to approach learning Houdini, and some of the fundamental concepts behind how it works. Understanding these concepts lays a solid foundation on which to continue building and understanding Houdini.
56187691271635.name: Presentation - Utrecht - Approaching Houdini: Effective Learning Techniques | H16.5

56187691271636.author: Nikolay Skolkov
56187691271636.description: Nikolay covers some of the techniques used at Wargaming for the mind blowing cinematics they create, including... 1) Rust spreading / Decay, 2) Low-Cost Sand Storm, 3) FEM Crushed Car.
56187691271636.name: Presentation - Utrecht - Houdini for Game Cinematics | H16.5

56187691271637.author: Scott Keating
56187691271637.description: SideFX's Scott Keating demonstrates tools to help you design and plan your virtual worlds - including polygon reduction and procedural set dressing techniques as well as some of the ways Houdini can be used to analyze your scene and optimize your resources.
56187691271637.name: Presentation - Utrecht - Houdini for VR | H16.5

56187691271638.author: Simon Fiedler
56187691271638.description: Simon demonstrates a collection of techniques on how to create geometry using simple VEX code and deforming objects with generated data.
56187691271638.name: Presentation - Utrecht - Point by Point | H16.5

56187691271639.author: Tim van Helsdingen
56187691271639.description: Netherlands studio Colorbleed asked freelance artist Tim van Helsdingen to come on board once again to work on a single-shot FX filled extravaganza for Solidgear. Tim outlines his setups, the issues they faced, and how they handled the Houdini > Maya/Vray pipeline.
56187691271639.name: Presentation - Utrecht - Destroy the Shoe | H16.5

56187691271640.author: Etienne Carrier
56187691271640.description: How do you create 100 square km of wilderness with a terrain changing every day? Ubisoft's solution on 'Far Cry 5' was to develop a set of procedural tools to generate biomes, texture the terrain, setup freshwater networks, generate cliff rocks and more.
56187691271640.name: Presentation - Utrecht - Procedural World Generation of Ubisoft's Far Cry 5 | H16.5

56187691271641.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271641.description: Houdini provides so many different ways to build up networks that we must always KISS: Keep It Simple Stupid. This webinar will focus on simplifying the simulation of Pyro in Houdini.
56187691271641.name: Webinar - KISS Pyro FX | H16.5

56187691271642.author: Kenny Lammers
56187691271642.description: Shows beginning Houdini users how to construct game ready units using Houdini. The learning series shows the process of building up the parts and pieces of the props using only Houdini to procedurally produce each asset.
56187691271642.name: Long Tutorial - Guard Tower Series | H16.5

56187691271643.author: Simon Holmedal
56187691271643.description: Simon shows his workflow when designing abstract effects for motion graphics using Houdini as his primary weapon of choice from early development and RND to final production. We also review the development of the title sequence for 'Us by night'.
56187691271643.name: Presentation - FMX - Procedural Title Sequence | H16.5

56187691271644.author: Moritz Schwind & Manuel Cassola Merkle
56187691271644.description: Manuel And Moritz present the techniques they've been implementing since deciding to use Houdini as their go to tool for advanced motion graphics projects. They brought anecdotes, behind the scenes info, infamous hacks and other surprises.
56187691271644.name: Presentation - FMX - All Your Clones Are Belong To Us! | H16.5

56187691271645.author: Simon French & Dean Robinson
56187691271645.description: Electric Theatre Collective presents work from two of 2017's most creative and challenging fully CG projects - Pentakill 'Mortal Reminder' and GWR 'Five go on a Great Western Adventure'.
56187691271645.name: Presentation - FMX - Pentakill and GWR | H16.5

56187691271646.author: Alex Hammond & Dan Yargici
56187691271646.description: Over the course of six months a team of Mill artists worked to realise the vision of cult director GMUNK and his brief. The task was to visualise the way an artificial intelligence might perceive, conceive and create a car ad for Audi.
56187691271646.name: Presentation - FMX - Audi Pure Imagination | H16.5

56187691271647.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271647.description: Learn about many different ways you can use to make, shape and bend water entirely in Houdini. Make water conform to deforming shapes, creating directed stormy oceans, calm water with ripples, dripping water, water with variable viscosity, bubbles and more.
56187691271647.name: Presentation - FMX - Five Elements of VFX - Water | H16.5

56187691271648.author: Sergio Caires
56187691271648.description: The evolution of the subsurface scatter shader over the years at Axis Animation.
56187691271648.name: Presentation - FMX - Custom Shading in Game Trailers | H16.5

56187691271649.author: Andreas Glad
56187691271649.description: How to create a Paintsplat projectile in UE4. I'll take you through the creation of Vertex Animation Texture splashes as well as creating a decal based on baking a FLIP splat. We will start with an empty Houdini scene and finish with a paintlaunching gun in engine.
56187691271649.name: Long Tutorial - VAT Paintsplat | H16.5

56187691271650.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271650.description: Part Two on MSS focuses on CVEX overrides and using MSS outside of Houdini. The bottlecaps example is worked up from scratch in Houdini looking at the process of using VOPs to construct a CVEX run-time procedural.
56187691271650.name: Webinar - Material Style Sheets - Pt 2 | H16.5

56187691271651.author: Mike Lyndon
56187691271651.description: The Fire Presets Tool wraps up the source, solver and visualisation of a pyro sim making it quicker and easier to generate fire of different sizes as well as use your own source to emit fire from.
56187691271651.name: Long Tutorial - Fire Presets | H16.5

56187691271652.author: Will MacNeil
56187691271652.description: Will MacNeil talks about recent design work at The Mill, with a focus on two projects: 1) MUSTANG - a playful new spot for Ford Mustang's latest campaign, 'Make it Personal', and 2) LUSH - a film created via biometric data visualization.
56187691271652.name: Presentation - VERTEX - Adventures In Procedural Design | H16.5

56187691271653.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271653.description: Focus on using Material Style Sheets to apply material looks and Mantra render properties to Packed archives. Also look at SOHO and how it relates to Material Style Sheets. A few examples will be worked up covering the most used options of Material Style sheets.
56187691271653.name: Webinar - Material Style Sheets - Pt 1 | H16.5

56187691271654.author: Kenny Lammers
56187691271654.description: Learn how the Houdini Engine and Procedural Content workflows can help you produce your game content faster and with the ability to change that content on the fly. Learn how to install  Houdini Engine and how to incorporate assets into your game content pipeline.
56187691271654.name: Presentation - GDC - Procedural Game Content Workflows in Houdini, Houdini Engine, and Unity | H16.5

56187691271655.author: Robert Magee
56187691271655.description: For game devs new to Houdini, this presentation shows concepts and ideas that make Houdini, and its procedural node-based workflow, the perfect solution for creating next level game art. Also learn how to access Learning Paths for building up your Houdini skills.
56187691271655.name: Presentation - GDC - Houdini Foundations | H16.5

56187691271656.author: Ari Danesh
56187691271656.description: Create realistic terrains for games using Houdini's height field tools. Starting from scratch, add patterns, noise and 3D projections to shape the terrain, then erosion tools for added levels of realism. Learn to scatter points to populate the terrain with trees, rocks, and snow.
56187691271656.name: Presentation - GDC - Building Terrains | H16.5

56187691271657.author: Paul Ambrosiussen
56187691271657.description: Paul demonstrates that Houdini for Game Development is NOT hard(!) by featuring ways GameDev Tools simplify your workflow. Using the toolset in Houdini enables you to focus on building high-quality creative experiences, rather than technical nightmares.
56187691271657.name: Presentation - GDC - Game Development Made Easy Using Houdini | H16.5

56187691271658.author: Robert Magee
56187691271658.description: Discover the best way to bring procedural tools into Autodesk Maya and Autodesk 3DS Max. Build digital assets in Houdini then open them up in their favorite app while the Houdini Engine plug-ins run under-the-hood to deliver game-ready content.
56187691271658.name: Presentation - GDC - Houdini Engine for Autodesk Maya and 3DS Max | H16.5

56187691271659.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271659.description: Discover the production techniques used on this year's SideFX game demo. Luiz will be sharing some details on a wide variety of tricks designed for games, including tips on Terrain, Houdini Engine, Sweeping Geometry, Stadium Crowds, Modelling and Texturing.
56187691271659.name: Presentation - GDC - Game Development Tips and Tricks | H16.5

56187691271660.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271660.description: As Photogrammetry becomes a deeper part of productions, the need for a pipeline emerges. Luiz will show how to use Houdini and Reality Capture to generate high resolution meshes and convert them to game ready assets in minutes.
56187691271660.name: Presentation - GDC - Automated Photogrammetry To Game Res Pipeline | H16.5

56187691271661.author: Mike Lyndon
56187691271661.description: In this video you will see how to use multiple game dev tools to quickly generate production quality fire assets and get them into your game engine. And then we'll cover some tools and techniques for getting fluid data from Houdini into your game engine.
56187691271661.name: Presentation - GDC - High Quality Integrated Workflows Made Easy | H16.5

56187691271662.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271662.description: Houdini's powerful material context, combined with Mantra, allows for a new way of texturing high resolution assets. Quixel's high quality Megascans are a great compliment to that workflow; allow Luiz to teach you the fundamentals of Houdini shaders.
56187691271662.name: Presentation - GDC - Texturing in Houdini using Quixel Megascans | H16.5

56187691271663.author: Anjeong Go & Fianna Wong
56187691271663.description: There are many ways to create a game environment - we have developed an automatic map creator for strategy or RPG-style games. Using this Hex Map Generator, it is possible to iterate many times without committing to a final map design.
56187691271663.name: Presentation - GDC - Hex Map Generator | H16.5

56187691271664.author: Rob Stauffer
56187691271664.description: Discover ways to rapidly create variants of game assets using Houdini's procedural workflow. Explore methods for generating textures and geometry by iterating over value ranges (wedging).
56187691271664.name: Presentation - GDC - Make More Assets | H16.5

56187691271665.author: Anastasia Opara
56187691271665.description: Human mechanisms of representing the surrounding world in a form of 'language' is an outstanding ability that enables us to store the information as internal compact abstractions.
56187691271665.name: Presentation - GDC - Creativity of Rules and Patterns: Designing Procedural Systems | H16.5

56187691271666.author: Alex Dracott
56187691271666.description: Generating HeightField terrain textures within Houdini. The basic pipeline of taking mask and height information from your Heightfield terrain, bringing it into a COP image network to generate textures and splat maps, and finally bringing it back onto your terrain.
56187691271666.name: Presentation - GDC - Generating HeightField Terrain Textures in Houdini | H16.5

56187691271667.author: Mike Murdock
56187691271667.description: With Houdini, you're not just building 3d models, you're building reusable tools for your project. For Marshmallow Melee (a toy-scale VR battle game), we created a pipeline using procedural tools that allowed the team to see more in context.
56187691271667.name: Presentation - GDC - Procedural Tools for Building VR worlds: A case study from Marshmallow Melee | H16.5

56187691271668.author: Matt Vitalone
56187691271668.description: The latest Call of Duty game required realistic oceans and breaking waves on the beaches of Normandy that could run at 60fps. Find out how Houdini Ocean Toolkit and FLIP Fluids were used to build the data that drives these real-time oceans.
56187691271668.name: Presentation - GDC - Creating Real-Time Oceans for Call of Duty: WWII | H16.5

56187691271669.author: Michael Pavlovich
56187691271669.description: Welcome to this Houdini Game Dev Toolset series by Michael Pavlovich! After watching these short introductory videos, you'll be able to create your own automated pipeline for asset creation in minutes.
56187691271669.name: Long Tutorial - High-res Mesh Pipeline | H16.5

56187691271670.author: Fianna Wong
56187691271670.description: Shows how you can sew UVs on a geometry with pre-existing seams, using UV Flatten. Be sure to watch the 'UV Flatten | Cut, Sew, Align & Straighten' video if you wish for more information on the different modes and options within UV Flatten.
56187691271670.name: Quick Tutorial - UV Flatten | Sew UVs with Pre-existing Seams | H16.5

56187691271671.author: Fianna Wong
56187691271671.description: Modes within UV Flatten, which allow you to cut seams, sew seams, pin vertices, align vertices in U or V direction, and straighten edge loops. Also the flattening methods available: Spectral and Angle-Based and the options that are associated with each.
56187691271671.name: Quick Tutorial - UV Flatten | Cut, Sew, Align & Straighten | H16.5

56187691271672.author: Scott Keating
56187691271672.description: Learn how to set up a basic destruction simulation in less than 30 minutes! Presented by SideFX's Scott Keating at The VFX Festival in London, this quick overview makes it easy to follow along.
56187691271672.name: Long Tutorial - VFX FESTIVAL - Intro to VFX | H16.5

56187691271673.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271673.description: Good collision geometry for the various DOP solvers in Houdini. Looks at both Bullet collision geometry and FLIP colliding against static, deforming and height field colliders. Also Particle collision geometry, both SDF and surface collisions and Pyro colliders.
56187691271673.name: Webinar - Collisions - Part 3 | H16.5

56187691271674.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271674.description: Good collision geometry for the various DOP solvers in Houdini. Looks at both Bullet collision geometry and FLIP colliding against static, deforming and height field colliders. Also Particle collision geometry, both SDF and surface collisions and Pyro colliders.
56187691271674.name: Webinar - Collisions - Part 2 | H16.5

56187691271675.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271675.description: Good collision geometry for the various DOP solvers in Houdini. Looks at both Bullet collision geometry and FLIP colliding against static, deforming and height field colliders. Also Particle collision geometry, both SDF and surface collisions and Pyro colliders.
56187691271675.name: Webinar - Collisions - Part 1 | H16.5

56187691271676.author: Paul Ambrosiussen
56187691271676.description: Different ways to install the Game Development Toolset provided by SideFX. The Game Development Toolset is a set of tools to assist the workflow of mainly, but not exclusively Game Devs. Contains Shelves, Digital Assets, Custom Desktops and Scripts.
56187691271676.name: Quick Tutorial - Game Development Toolset Installation | H16.5

56187691271678.author: Bjorn Sorensen
56187691271678.description: In this final video, we will be creating a digital asset of our quadruped rig, to be able to export it for use in a pipeline. We will also be taking a quick look at how to expose and edit select parameters in the finished asset.
56187691271678.name: Quick Tutorial - Cat Quad-Rigging - 14 - Digital Asset | H16.5

56187691271679.author: Bjorn Sorensen
56187691271679.description: In this video, we will be exploring different methods of capturing the geometry, to drive it with the bones of the rig. We will also be looking into mirroring of the bind and the delta mush node.
56187691271679.name: Quick Tutorial - Cat Quad-Rigging - 13 - Capturing | H16.5

56187691271680.author: Bjorn Sorensen
56187691271680.description: In this video, we will be creating the eye setup for the character using look-at constraints.
56187691271680.name: Quick Tutorial - Cat Quad-Rigging - 12 - Eyes | H16.5

56187691271681.author: Bjorn Sorensen
56187691271681.description: In this video, we will be connecting the blendshapes up to our face controllers, so that the animator can drive the shapes of the face. We will also be looking into methods of limiting our controller nulls from translating too far away from the character.
56187691271681.name: Quick Tutorial - Cat Quad-Rigging - 11 - Head Finalization | H16.5

56187691271682.author: Bjorn Sorensen
56187691271682.description: In this video, we will be creating the head setup for the quadruped with jaw and ears. We will also be importing and testing our blendshapes for the face.
56187691271682.name: Quick Tutorial - Cat Quad-Rigging - 10 - Head | H16.5

56187691271683.author: Bjorn Sorensen
56187691271683.description: In this video, we will be creating the neck for the creature with an IK/FK switch.
56187691271683.name: Quick Tutorial - Cat Quad-Rigging - 09 - Neck | H16.5

56187691271684.author: Bjorn Sorensen
56187691271684.description: In this video, we will be connecting the various rig parts up, and setting up a blend system for the front legs so that they can be driven by either the hip or world.
56187691271684.name: Quick Tutorial - Cat Quad-Rigging - 08 - Connecting | H16.5

56187691271685.author: Bjorn Sorensen
56187691271685.description: In this video, we will be creating the tail setup with both IK and FK controllers. After having created the tail, we are going to connect it up to the spine.
56187691271685.name: Quick Tutorial - Cat Quad-Rigging - 07 - Tail | H16.5

56187691271686.author: Bjorn Sorensen
56187691271686.description: In this video, we will be creating a spine, and during the video, we will be exploring two different methods for creating an IK setup on a bone chain driven by a NURBS curve.
56187691271686.name: Quick Tutorial - Cat Quad-Rigging - 06 - Spine | H16.5

56187691271687.author: Bjorn Sorensen
56187691271687.description: In this video, we will be mirroring our front and hind leg setup with the mirror tool. After mirroring the rig legs we will proceed to connect our custom parameters up to the new mirrored legs and making the rig ready for the next step.
56187691271687.name: Quick Tutorial - Cat Quad-Rigging - 05 - Mirroring | H16.5

56187691271688.author: Bjorn Sorensen
56187691271688.description: In this video, we will be creating the hind leg of the quadruped with IK/FK blend, twist effectors and custom parameters. This process used in the video will be very similar to the one used when rigging the front leg, seen in the previous two videos.
56187691271688.name: Quick Tutorial - Cat Quad-Rigging - 04 - Hind Leg | H16.5

56187691271689.author: Bjorn Sorensen
56187691271689.description: In this second of two videos, we will be finalizing the front leg. In this video, we will be creating twist effectors and custom parameters to drive the IK/FK blend.
56187691271689.name: Quick Tutorial - Cat Quad-Rigging - 03 - Front Leg Finalization | H16.5

56187691271690.author: Bjorn Sorensen
56187691271690.description: In this first of two videos, we will be building part of the front leg. In this video, we will be creating the bone chain for the leg and setting up the FK controllers along with the IK.
56187691271690.name: Quick Tutorial - Cat Quad-Rigging - 02 - Front Leg | H16.5

56187691271691.author: Bjorn Sorensen
56187691271691.description: In this video we will be importing our geometry, assigning a material and creating a world controller null, so that we are ready to rig the character.
56187691271691.name: Quick Tutorial - Cat Quad-Rigging - 01 - Getting Started | H16.5

56187691271692.author: Bjorn Sorensen
56187691271692.description: Intro to the series. Rigging a quadruped character from scratch - from basic techniques for creating bones, capturing geometry, setting up IK for bones, blendshapes for the face, creating spine and tail, as well as creating custom parameters to controllers for additional user control.
56187691271692.name: Quick Tutorial - Cat Quad-Rigging - Intro | H16.5

56187691271693.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271693.description: Utility SOP to delete small disconnected pieces.
56187691271693.name: Quick Tutorial - Games Tools - Delete Small Parts | H16.5

56187691271694.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271694.name: Quick Tutorial - Games Tools - Calculate Occlusion SOP | H16.5

56187691271695.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271695.description: The polydeform node lets you warp a model into the general shape of another. Useful in photogrametry pipelines.
56187691271695.name: Quick Tutorial - Games Tools - PolyDeform | H16.5

56187691271696.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271696.description: Added Sharpen Features to the Voxel Mesh SOP, Which allows users to get better hard edge models.
56187691271696.name: Quick Tutorial - Games Tools - Voxelmesh Update | H16.5

56187691271697.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271697.description: Updates to the OSM tool with some better attribute handling.
56187691271697.name: Quick Tutorial - Games Tools - Multi File SOP | H16.5

56187691271698.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271698.description: Simple node to load multiple geometry files at once.
56187691271698.name: Quick Tutorial - Games Tools - Multi File SOP | H16.5

56187691271699.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271699.description: Few updates to the Instant Meshes SOP to expose more control.
56187691271699.name: Quick Tutorial - Games Tools - Instant Meshes Update | H16.5

56187691271700.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271700.description: Utility SOP to store the filename of a file SOP as its detail attributes to be then used in other SOPs.
56187691271700.name: Quick Tutorial - Games Tools - Extract Filename | H16.5

56187691271701.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271701.description: The Axis Align SOP is a simple utility tool to help artists align meshes quickly. It lets you control XYZ alignments with ease.
56187691271701.name: Quick Tutorial - Games Tools - Axis Align SOP | H16.5

56187691271702.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271702.description: This video covers some updates to the Auto UV SOP as well as some more info on its capabilities.
56187691271702.name: Quick Tutorial - Games Tools - Auto UV Update | H16.5

56187691271703.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271703.description: Updates to the OSM tool with some better attribute handling.
56187691271703.name: Quick Tutorial - Games Tools - OSM Import Update | H16.5

56187691271704.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271704.description: Quick Shade style node, but can handle Normals and other PBR parameters.
56187691271704.name: Quick Tutorial - Games Tools - Quick Material SOP | H16.5

56187691271705.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271705.description: Wrapper around the Games Baker, but in SOPs. Making it easier than ever to bake information from HighRes to Low.
56187691271705.name: Quick Tutorial - Games Tools - Soften Normals | H16.5

56187691271706.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271706.description: Utility SOP for softening the normals and hardening based on UV seams.
56187691271706.name: Quick Tutorial - Games Tools - Soften Normals | H16.5

56187691271707.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271707.description: The Thicken SOP is meant to make a planar surface water tight, by smartly extruding it and welding it back on itself.
56187691271707.name: Quick Tutorial - Games Tools - Thicken SOP | H16.5

56187691271708.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271708.description: The UV Unitize SOP simply sets the UVs for each face to be from 0-1.
56187691271708.name: Quick Tutorial - Games Tools - UV Unitize | H16.5

56187691271709.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271709.description: The UV Visualize SOP is a handy tool for quickly visualizing the UV shells, seams and distortion in your mesh.
56187691271709.name: Quick Tutorial - Games Tools - UV Visualize SOP | H16.5

56187691271710.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271710.description: The Voxel Mesh SOP is a shortcut for the common VDB from Polygons > Convert VDB workflow. It also has some extra features like projecting to the original mesh and dilating/eroding the volume.
56187691271710.name: Quick Tutorial - Games Tools - Voxelmesh SOP | H16.5

56187691271711.author: Luis Garcia
56187691271711.description: Luis 'Lune' Garcia will show the basics of procedural modeling using Houdini and Houdini Engine to create game assets for Unity. The main goal is to increase your art quality while also reducing your production time.
56187691271711.name: Long Tutorial - Speeding up your 3D workflow with Procedural Modeling | H16

56187691271712.author: Kwanbo Kim
56187691271712.description: Take a closer look at the tools and technology being used to create 'Ary and the Secret of Seasons' with Kwanbo Kim, eXiin's Lead Artist. Some of the examples he will show you include trees, stairs, character rigging & animation, and more.
56187691271712.name: Long Tutorial - eXiin Workflow | H16

56187691271713.author: Andreas Glad
56187691271713.description: Learn how to create a flowmap using the new Flow Map tools in Houdini. You will see how control the flowmap velocities, and also how to manually comb it if you wish for more specific control. Then how to assemble your riverbed in Unreal Engine.
56187691271713.name: Long Tutorial - Flowmaps | H16.5

56187691271714.author: Fianna Wong
56187691271714.description: Learn how you can arbitrarily select uv islands, and pack that selection into an area of your uv tile which already has existing uv tiles. It also shows you what Pack Between Non-Group Islands can do, as well as the new option Pack Islands in Cavities.
56187691271714.name: Quick Tutorial - UV Layout | H16.5

56187691271715.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271715.description: This webinar focuses on good pipeline practices for the Houdini user. Whether you are a lone user plugging away or you are working with a large group of Houdini users within a studio pipeline, you have to know how to take control of the pipeline world around you.
56187691271715.name: Webinar - Houdini Pipelines | H16.5

56187691271716.author: Ari Danesh
56187691271716.description: This is a beginner tutorial. Learn about Point and Primitive attributes. Using the Particle SOP and the Primitive SOP. Learn how to create an inline DOPnetwork. Create point attributes to sort all the particles by emitter point and create curves...
56187691271716.name: Long Tutorial - A Little Particle Stream | H16

56187691271717.author: Rob Stauffer
56187691271717.description: In this class SideFX's Rob Stauffer covers the basics of working with grains. We will look using shelf tools for setting up dry and wet sand and will look at clumping and constraints.
56187691271717.name: Presentation - SIGG - Getting Started with Grains | H16

56187691271718.author: Cameron White
56187691271718.description: SideFX's Cameron White shows how to use Houdini's tools for simulating crowd agents as ragdolls. Topics covered include: best practices for setting up collision geometry and joint limits, crowd solver integration, heightfields, and more.
56187691271718.name: Presentation - SIGG - Masterclass: Crowds | H16

56187691271719.author: Scott Keating
56187691271719.description: SideFX's Scott Keating covers a variety of rigging methods inside of Houdini, from Auto-Rigging to custom networks. From there, he covers a variety of techniques for adding muscles to your character and simulating the result.
56187691271719.name: Presentation - SIGG - Rigging & Muscles | H16

56187691271720.author: Guillaume Laferriere
56187691271720.description: In this Masterclass, SideFX's Guillaume Laferriere demonstrates how to use the Constraints introduced in Houdini 16 to animate characters. How to reparent objects during animation, how to animate a rolling cube and how to make a character walk on a path.
56187691271720.name: Presentation - SIGG - Masterclass: Animating using CHOPs and Contraints | H16

56187691271721.author: Mikhail Lesin
56187691271721.description: Main Road Post's Mikhail Lesin provides in-depth details of VFX production for Attraction. We will go right from the early stage of pre-production through all fascinating effects. How we generate an authentic city and then destroy it, develop design of alien exoskeleton and spaceship, make genuine clouds and atmosphere...
56187691271721.name: Presentation - SIGG - VFX of 'Attraction' Motion Picture | NA

56187691271722.author: Steven Knipping
56187691271722.description: Steven Knipping of the Applied Houdini video tutorial series talks about Houdini 16's new workflows for making awesome looking fractures faster and easier! He'll discuss how to art direct certain material looks and when to use booleans, voronoi, for loops and more!
56187691271722.name: Presentation - SIGG - Boolean or not Boolean: Fun with Fracturing | H16

56187691271723.author: John Moncrief
56187691271723.description: Pluralsight's John Moncrief examines an advanced scatter tool created using HE for Unity. Takes you through building a tool that will randomize and scatter assets (like trees or rocks) based on several factors incl slope calculations, curve based boundaries, etc
56187691271723.name: Presentation - SIGG - Procedural Scattering in Houdini Engine and Unity | H16

56187691271724.author: Luiz Kruel / Mike Lyndon
56187691271724.description: Guides you through the workflows developed to make it easier to export data from Houdini to your game engine. Includes an overview of the games rendering pipeline, which informs a lot of the decisions on how to generate and optimize content. Essential viewing for Houdini TDs transitioning from film to games.
56187691271724.name: Presentation - SIGG - Houdini 16 Games Tools Updates | H16

56187691271725.author: Robert Magee
56187691271725.description: Learn how you can create procedural assets in Houdini that can be used to build game levels in UE4. He talks about how to create these assets in Houdini's node-based environment and how to deploy them using the Houdini Engine for UE4 plug-in.
56187691271725.name: Presentation - SIGG - Procedural Level Building in UE4 | H16

56187691271726.author: Rob Stauffer
56187691271726.description: SideFX's Rob Stauffer takes a look at the assets and workflows used to create a VR game in Unity. We will look at the assets we created and how they were incorporated in the game, including Houdini Engine.
56187691271726.name: Presentation - SIGG - Castle VR Overview | H16

56187691271727.author: Winslow Porter
56187691271727.description: New Reality Co., creators of the critically-acclaimed cinematic VR drama Giant and the haptically enhanced follow-up piece Tree, will expand upon their utilization of Houdini to finesse virtual environments with photorealistic 3D assets.
56187691271727.name: Presentation - SIGG - Virtual Authenticity: Houdini for VR Storytelling | H16

56187691271728.author: Saber Jlassi
56187691271728.description: Creating procedural rock formation and cliffs can be very challenging due to all the complex natural patterns. Using Houdini VDB volumes and voronoi fracturing, Saber Jlassi shows how this problem can be solved to create all kinds of complex rock formation.
56187691271728.name: Presentation - SIGG - Procedural Rock Formations for UE4 | H16

56187691271729.author: Fianna Wong
56187691271729.description: H16 was recently released only a few months ago, but we are already working on new tools. SideFX's Fianna Wong gives you a sneak peek on one of the features coming down the pipe for surfacing tools - specifically the TopoBuild toolset.
56187691271729.name: Presentation - SIGG - Topobuild 3.0 Sneak Peak | H16

56187691271730.author: Anastasia Opara
56187691271730.description: Procedural modelling is, in a way, like painting, where complexity emerges from the interaction of simple rules. Thus, we can achieve great intricacy and believability from layering the simplest rules if we analyse correctly our own thought patterns.
56187691271730.name: Presentation - SIGG - Believability in Procedural Modelling: Layering of Simple Rules | H16

56187691271731.author: Scott Keating
56187691271731.description: Covers some of Mantra's new rendering capabilities and how to take advantage of the new Material workflows in Houdini 16. From there, we will look at how to take advantage of Material Style Sheets when assigning materials and assembling your scene.
56187691271731.name: Presentation - SIGG - Lighting and Rendering | H16

56187691271732.author: Matt Ebb
56187691271732.description: Why use Houdini's perfectly good renderer when you can make your own weird substitute (inside Houdini)? Matt will show how a little bit of rendering knowledge can be dangerously useful.
56187691271732.name: Presentation - SIGG - Procedural Modelling/LookDev | H16

56187691271733.author: PANEL
56187691271733.description: Leading industry recruiters tell you everything you will need to know in order to make a great first impression, get your reel ready to show off, and more. Moderated by Ian Failes. Panelists from The Mill, Double Negative, and Pixar.
56187691271733.name: Presentation - SIGG - How to Get a Studio Job in FX | H16

56187691271734.author: Robert Magee
56187691271734.description: When Houdini artists talk, it can seem like they are speaking in a secret language. In this session, Robert Magee teaches you how to understand 'Houdini-speak' while learning how a node-based procedural workflow can support your film, TV and gamedev projects.
56187691271734.name: Presentation - SIGG - The Secret Language of Houdini | H16

56187691271735.author: Tighe Rzankowski
56187691271735.name: Presentation - SIGG - SideFX Intern Program - Feather Tools | H16

56187691271736.author: PANEL
56187691271736.description: A unique look at the transition from student to professional artist, from the perspective five young artists who have made such a transition. Moderated by Ian Failes. Panelists include Nema Safvati, David Chow Michelle Lee, Nha Ca Chau, and Kristen Eggleston.
56187691271736.name: Presentation - SIGG - A Day in the Life of a Studio Artist | H16

56187691271737.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271737.description: * SCENE FILES: http://sidefx.co/2t1w4Lv * SideFX's Jeff 'Old School' Wagner takes you through intermediate-level tips and tricks in Houdini Pyro... - Building Pyro networks inside
56187691271737.name: Webinar - Pyro Tips & Tricks | H16

56187691271738.author: Andreas Glad
56187691271738.description: In this one, you will learn how to create a mesh that is known by many names like, swooshes, soulercoasters, trailmeshes. In the tutorial, we'll build a tool (digital asset) that allows us to
56187691271738.name: Long Tutorial - CurveSweeper - Intro to Houdini Engine - Houdini for Games | H16

56187691271739.author: Michael Goldfarb
56187691271739.description: SideFX's own Michael Goldfarb takes you through all the latest and greatest rigging and animation features that are included in Houdini 16.
56187691271739.name: Presentation - EUE - Rigging in Houdini 16 | H16

56187691271740.author: Andreas Glad
56187691271740.description: Andreas Glad is a VFX Artist with a specialization in the games industry. In this session, he will share with you some of his valuable insights on how to optimize your realtime VFX workflow. http://www.partikel.co
56187691271740.name: Presentation - EUE - Assets That Care: Why I'm Rebuilding all my Realtime VFX Workflows in Houdini | H16

56187691271741.author: Simon Fiedler
56187691271741.description: Simon Fiedler is a freelance 3D Artist based in Mainz, Germany. In his discussion he will share a wide variety of tips and tricks using examples that include a procedurally-generated feather system
56187691271741.name: Presentation - EUE - Building Production Oriented Assets in Houdini | H16

56187691271742.author: Entagma (Moritz)
56187691271742.description: Moritz Schwind from Entagma provides his insights on designing in Houdini using algorithms, using the beautifully intricate design of a snowflake (snow crystal) as a key example.
56187691271742.name: Presentation - EUE - Algorithmic Design in Houdini | H16

56187691271743.author: Andreas Glad
56187691271743.description: This video is going to show how to create a cloudscape for Unreal Engine 4 using a skyrig that we're going to make in Houdini, then convert it to a mesh and use it as a spawn surface in Unreal.
56187691271743.name: Long Tutorial - Cloudscape - Houdini for Games | H16

56187691271744.author: Rob Stauffer
56187691271744.description: * Working files: http://sidefx.co/2qHyngk * SideFX's Rob Stauffer takes you through the basics of production in Houdini... - Houdini integration for beginners - Project structure and
56187691271744.name: Webinar - Houdini in the Pipeline | H16

56187691271745.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271745.description: * Working Files: http://sidefx.co/2s4qbrO * Jeff Wagner digs into VOPs - visual programming for everyone! VOPs delivers powerful shading and geometry manipulation tools and much more. Topics
56187691271745.name: Webinar - Houdini VOPs | H16

56187691271746.author: Helge Maus
56187691271746.description: 'Besides the various simulation solvers and the procedural approach of doing things, the integration into the Games and VFX world, through Digital Assets, is one of the key benefits for artists
56187691271746.name: Presentation - FMX - Intro to Motion Graphics | H16

56187691271747.author: Entagma
56187691271747.description: Entagma's Manuel & Moritz share their insights (and humour) on how to successfully combine physics, biology, VFX and design into a new approach to Motion Design using Houdini.
56187691271747.name: Presentation - FMX - Design/VFX/Generative Art | H16

56187691271748.author: Kai Stavginski
56187691271748.description: An introduction to Houdini 16's redesigned shading workflow and enhanced shading capabilities. With Material Networks, Houdini now has a unified context in which you build, combine and assign
56187691271748.name: Presentation - FMX - Shading in Houdini 16 | H16

56187691271749.author: Kai Stavginski
56187691271749.description: An introduction to Houdini 16's redesigned fur tools. Learn about the open SOP-based approach to grooming without black boxes, unrestricted layering of grooming operations and rich set of dedicated
56187691271749.name: Presentation - FMX - Fur in Houdini 16 | H16

56187691271750.author: Andreas Glad
56187691271750.description: Create a nice and thick mudsplash in Unreal Engine 4, using a FLIP tank in Houdini. Literally go from an empty scene, set up your FLIP tank, throw a rock down (it's really just a deformed sphere)
56187691271750.name: Long Tutorial - SplashMesh! - Houdini for Games | H16

56187691271751.author: Jeff Wagner
56187691271751.description: SideFX's Jeff 'Old School' Wagner dives into geometry workflows in Houdini 16, including the new SOPs and network-building methods. Topics will include: - Copy SOP replacements
56187691271751.name: Webinar - Geometry Workflows in Houdini 16 | H16

56187691271752.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271752.description: SideFX's Luiz Kruel explores Houdini 16's new Games Shelf Tools. Topics include: - Learn how to create simple source scenes for cloth,
56187691271752.name: Webinar - Houdini for Games | H16

56187691271758.author: Robert Magee
56187691271758.description: In this presentation, Robert Magee will show how you can create procedural assets in Houdini that can be loaded into Unreal Engine 4 using the Houdini Engine plug-in. He will talk about how assets
56187691271758.name: Presentation - GDC - Procedural Assets for UE4 | H16

56187691271759.author: Luis Garcia
56187691271759.description: Luis Garcia, also known as 'Lune' is an indie game developer working on the project 'Suki & the Shadow Klaw' for Playstation 4, Xbox One, Playstation Vita and PC platforms.
56187691271759.name: Presentation - GDC - Procedural Art for Indies | H16

56187691271760.author: Gabriel Valdivia
56187691271760.description: In his presentation, Gabriel talks about the Castle Defender VR project. He walks through the creation of the Houdini Digital Assets used to build the cartoony environment, along with how they were implemented using Houdini Engine. He also talks about the process of creating the game characters in Houdini from modeling to rigging to animation.
56187691271760.name: Presentation - GDC - Castle Defender VR | H16

56187691271761.author: Michael Lyndon
56187691271761.description: Michael Lyndon is a visual effects artist, teacher, mentor and team leader. He has a broad range of experience creating computer graphics for commercials, films and video games.Michael's talk
56187691271761.name: Presentation - GDC - Herding Rocks - Procedural Animation | H16

56187691271762.author: Luiz Kruel
56187691271762.description: In this presentation, Luiz teaches how to use the new Games Tool Shelf that is included with Houdini 16. He will go over the new normal map nodes for COPs, Flowmap Tools, Make Loop SOP, RBD to FBX
56187691271762.name: Presentation - GDC - Houdini 16 Game Shelf | H16

56187691271763.author: Fianna Wong
56187691271763.name: Quick Tutorial - Network Editor | Duplicate Wires | H16

56187691271764.author: Fianna Wong
56187691271764.name: Quick Tutorial - Network Editor | Align | H16

56187691271765.author: Fianna Wong
56187691271765.name: Quick Tutorial - Network Editor | Dots & Wires | H16

56187691271766.author: Fianna Wong
56187691271766.name: Quick Tutorial - Network Editor | Stickies, Network Boxes & Background Images | H16

56187691271767.author: Fianna Wong
56187691271767.name: Quick Tutorial - Network Editor | Quickmarks | H16

56187691271768.author: Fianna Wong
56187691271768.name: Quick Tutorial - Hair & Fur | Masking | H16

56187691271769.author: Fianna Wong
56187691271769.name: Quick Tutorial - Hair & Fur | Guide Process | H16

56187691271771.author: Fianna Wong
56187691271771.name: Quick Tutorial - Viscosity with Slippage | H16

56187691271774.author: Fianna Wong
56187691271774.name: Quick Tutorial - Network Editor | Node Ring & Info Panel | H16

56187691271775.author: Fianna Wong
56187691271775.name: Quick Tutorial - Network Editor | Dependencies | H16

56187691271776.author: Fianna Wong
56187691271776.name: Quick Tutorial - Network Editor | Colors, Shapes & Navigator | H16

56187691271777.author: Fianna Wong
56187691271777.name: Quick Tutorial - Terrain | Heightfield Overview | H16

10382418825311.author: Jeff Lait
10382418825311.description: Designed for artists that want to understand how fluid solvers work, senior mathematician Jeff Lait walks you through the process of creating both grid and particle-based fluid solvers from scratch. Focus is placed on the visual effect of the various microsolvers, not the mathematics, in the hopes of demystifying what is often treated as an impenetrable black box.
10382418825311.name: Masterclass - H12 - Building Fluid Solvers from Scratch | Jeff Lait

10382418825313.author: Jeff Lait
10382418825313.description: Houdini 15 has introduced a new way to do loops in VOPs and SOPs. This masterclass provides an overview of the new looping constructs. With the new constructs; effects that used to require significant technical knowledge to achieve with Foreach SOPs can now be readily built.
10382418825313.name: Masterclass - H15 - Loops | Jeff Lait

15549621505822.author: Ari Danesh
15549621505822.description: This two hour video goes through the basic workflow of creating terrains in H17. After explaining my basic workflow we spend a bulk of time discussing the new erosion model and how to utilize its parameters.
15549621505822.name: Masterclass - H17 - Terrains | Ari Danesh

16435260789825.author: Jeff Lait
16435260789825.description: This masterclass will cover the new improvements in Vellum for cloth simulation in Houdini 18.0. This includes improved resolution independence and new constraints.
16435260789825.name: Masterclass - H18 - Vellum Cloth Updates | Jeff Lait

17006633344641.description: using adjustprimlength from the groom.h to carve multiple curves
17006633344641.name: multi carve via groom.h

23460558499346.author: Jeff Lait
23460558499346.description: Houdini 18.0 has expanded support for 64 bit geometry processing. This masterclass runs over the new functionality and shows how to run Vellum solvers in 64-bit mode.
23460558499346.name: Masterclass - H18 - 64 bit processing - pdg, pipeline, vellum | Jeff Lait

23761080247908.author: Matt Estela @ CGWiki
23761080247908.description: remove points outside of the cam view
23761080247908.name: Remove Points outside of Camera view

26496209801591.author: Ari Danesh
26496209801591.description: The Heightfield Scatter node has be totally rewritten to allow hierarchical scattering, fixed point distribution and more. This video will explain the parameters and show how to wire up geometry for hierarchical scattering.
26496209801591.name: Masterclass - H17 - Terrains - Heightfield Scatter | Ari Danesh

28593757653688.author: Matt Estela from CGWiki
28593757653688.description: removes a point by checking its saturation
28593757653688.name: Remove point based on Color Saturation

347322426516.author: Hristo Velev
347322426516.description: creates a sin wave motion runnning over the z-axis
347322426516.name: Sin Wave along Z Axis

40830345542249.author: Kai Stavginski
40830345542249.description: This masterclass provides an overview of new and existing shading features in Houdini 15. This includes an introduction to the new SHOP shaders as well as shading and layering in VOPs. We also take a deeper look at working with BSDFs to build custom shaders.
